added_lines: # -*- encoding: utf-8 -*- # Copyright (c) 2016 b<>com # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. # from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log from watcher.decision_engine.planner.loading.default import \ DefaultPlannerLoader LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) CONF = cfg.CONF default_planner = 'basic' WATCHER_PLANNER_OPTS = { cfg.StrOpt('planner', default=default_planner, required=True, help='The selected planner used to schedule the actions'), cfg.IntOpt('version', default=1, required=True, help='The selected version of the planner', ), } planner_opt_group = cfg.OptGroup(name='watcher_planner', title='Defines the parameters of ' 'the planner') CONF.register_group(planner_opt_group) CONF.register_opts(WATCHER_PLANNER_OPTS, planner_opt_group) class PlannerManager(object): def __init__(self): self._loader = DefaultPlannerLoader() @property def loader(self): return self._loader def load(self): selected_planner = CONF.watcher_planner.planner selected_planner_version = CONF.watcher_planner.version return self.loader.load(name=selected_planner, version=selected_planner_version)

commit_message:
Add a common generic dynamic loader for watcher

In watcher, an audit generates a set of actions which
aims at achieving a given goal (lower energy consumption, ...).
It is possible to configure different strategies in order to achieve
each goal. Each strategy is written as a Python class which produces
a set of actions. Today, the set of possible actions is fixed for a
given version of Watcher and enables optimization algorithms to
include actions such as instance migration, changing hypervisor state,
changing power state (ACPI level, ...).

This patchset add a common generic dynamic loader for plugins,
such as for custom Actions, Strategies, Planners, etc.

Partially implements: blueprint watcher-add-actions-via-conf

Change-Id: I59d031b93865fff2540e3973921e1bdafa95f88e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher refs/changes/82/264782/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed
even if environment variables of the proxy are set. This is
a new feature above tox 2.0, you can check it from [1].

This patch fix this problem.

[1]. https://tox.readthedocs.org/en/latest/example/basic.html#passing-down-environment-variables

Change-Id: Ia39279508094f303cf8235329cd4adbbf33c9966
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/34/266634/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: passenv = http_proxy HTTP_PROXY https_proxy HTTPS_PROXY no_proxy NO_PROXY

commit_message:
Make verbose and quiet mutually exclusive

It doesn't make any sense to allow --verbose and --quiet, so
make put them in a mutually exclusive group.

Change-Id: Ie52bec3eb134863591888637f4d44a54efd2d2ce

added_lines: def test_verbose(): app, command = make_app() app.clean_up = mock.MagicMock(name='clean_up') app.run(['--verbose', 'mock']) app.clean_up.assert_called_once_with(command.return_value, 0, None) app.clean_up.reset_mock() app.run(['--quiet', 'mock']) app.clean_up.assert_called_once_with(command.return_value, 0, None) try: app.run(['--verbose', '--quiet', 'mock']) except SystemExit: pass else: raise Exception('Exception was not thrown')

commit_message:
Compare node groups in CDH plugin IMPALA validation

Because instances are not initialized during validation, compare node
groups instead. Using node group id beacuse NodeGroupReasouce is not
hashable for python set.

Change-Id: I3dd01c00d1efdaffdea1000913e4f650db72ff3a
Closes-bug: #1527533

commit_message:
Add doc for deferred_help parameter

This commit adds a parameter doc. This parameter was introduced before.
But there's no param doc for it, although the others have them.

Change-Id: I603ec8b4fbd01d017717832c8762ec3975dfa365

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-12 15:17:46.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/27bf868c509342442ec4e43d82274c0bb44b9b27', 'message': "Don't die when yum fails.

Not all yum failures has to be considered

function should implement the same behavior in Fedora,
CentOS and Ubuntu. Let return the error to be solved at higher

Co-Authored-By: Federico Ressi <federico.ressi@intel.com>

Change-Id: I41124c123579a19a281b8e7e02d787e53fac0602
Closes-Bug: #1522590

commit_message:
Don't die when yum fails.

Not all yum failures has to be considered
catastrofic failures also because install_package
function should implement the same behavior in Fedora,
CentOS and Ubuntu. Let return the error to be solved at higher
level.
Adjustment from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/263061/.

Co-Authored-By: Federico Ressi <federico.ressi@intel.com>

Change-Id: I41124c123579a19a281b8e7e02d787e53fac0602
Closes-Bug: #1522590
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/28/266428/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: END { exit fail }' result=$? local _PIPESTATUS=${PIPESTATUS[0]} if [ $result != 0 ]; then echo $LINENO "Missing packages detected" elif [[ ${_PIPESTATUS} != 0 ]]; then # also ensure we catch a yum failure echo $LINENO "${YUM:-yum} install failure" result=1 return $result
deleted_lines: END { exit fail }' || \ die $LINENO "Missing packages detected" # also ensure we catch a yum failure if [[ ${PIPESTATUS[0]} != 0 ]]; then die $LINENO "${YUM:-yum} install failure"

commit_message:
Fix bypass_url and errors with no headers

When using bypass_url the endpoint_override needs to be set in the
SessionClient.
Don't assume all responses have a Content-Type

Fixes Bug: 1532278
Change-Id: I5e1319aae28e16448e20dd2b41836341f3156c59

commit_message:
Fix pep8 failure

Current code contains W503 and E402 violation and patches cannot
pass on the gate.
This patch fixes them.

Change-Id: I28743ca44f9cd9b93ae4df0623d7381cadb95f4e
Closes-Bug: #1533526

commit_message:
Update Ceph doc for RadosGW

Implements blueprint radosgw-container

Change-Id: Icc397cc90a64e5af5f844de089fe57c7c1dd651e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/84/261284/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: RadosGW is optional, enable it in /etc/kolla/globals.yml: :: enable_ceph_rgw: "yes" To successfull deploy, RGW requires healthy cluster. So, in case of all-in-one deployment, Ceph should be configured with appropriate default pools size before deployment. See #managing-ceph Before deploy, modify the file /etc/kolla/config/ceph.conf and add the contents:: [global] osd pool default size = 1 osd pool default min size = 1
deleted_lines: The following example demonstrates how to change the number of copies for the pool to 1: :: docker exec ceph_mon ceph osd pool set rbd size 1 If Glance, Nova, and cinder have been deployed, all pools have to be modified. An example of modifying the pools to have 2 copies: :: for p in images vms volumes backups; do docker exec ceph_mon ceph osd pool set ${p} size 2; done If using a cache tier, these changes must be made as well: :: for p in images vms volumes backups; do docker exec ceph_mon ceph osd pool set ${p}-cache size 2; done The default pool Ceph creates is named 'rbd'. It is safe to remove this pool: :: docker exec ceph_mon ceph osd pool delete rbd rbd --yes-i-really-really-mean-it

commit_message:
Set ha=False for Neutron router's creation

Creation of ha router require at least two l3 agents to be present.
As ostf tests can be run for one controller, set ha=False to prevent
failure.

Change-Id: Ibdc20ac9df9df1cfd9619792536cf1ee1833efcb

commit_message:
Disable execution of dbsync for Murano Dashboard

Since Horizon uses memcache as session engine in MOS,
we need to disable execution of dbsync for Murano Dashboard.

Change-Id: I57e03734720e3dd35cdfce6ed628171ac398456a
Closes-Bug: #1527478

commit_message:
[Spec] Updates for scenario output format

Current spec for improvements in scenario output
needs some updates, such as output validation and
saving errors that come in output data

Change-Id: Id1535a88d8c3d3c438f85e41e81e21c5349272e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/77/253477/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {"error": "Items can not be determined"}, # Failure {"error": "This query has failed"}, # Failure for name, data in ("additive", additive), ("complete", complete): if data: schema = getattr(objects.task, "%s_OUTPUT_SCHEMA" % name.upper()) try: jsonschema.validate(data, schema) self._output[name].append(data) except jsonschema.ValidationError as e: self._output[name].append({"error": str(e)}) * implement subtabs under *Scenario Data*: *Aggregated*, *Errors* and *Per iteration* * *Errors* subtab is optional and shows errors (if any) from additive data * *Per iteration* subtab shows charts with complete data, for each iteration Aggregated Errors Per iteration ------ -------------UI sketch for active "Errors" subtab, let we have iterations 3 and 7 that set errors in additive data: .. code-block:: .---------------. | Scenario Data | ----' '------------------- Aggregated Errors Per iteration ---------- ------------- 3 This is an error message that was set by iteration 3 for some additive data 3 This is another error message that was set by iteration 3 for another additive data 7 This is an error message that was set by iteration 7 for some additive data UI sketch for active "Per iteration" subtab, let it be iteration 5 Aggregated Per iteration UI sketch for active "Per iteration" subtab (let it be iteration 5), with errors message set for second data set: .. code-block:: .---------------. | Scenario Data | ----' '------------------- Aggregated Per iteration ---------- [iteration 5] <Custom chart title> ---------------------------- | | | Any available chart widget | | | ---------------------------- <Custom chart title> This is an error message that was set, so this error is shown instead of chart [... more charts]
deleted_lines: if additive: self._output["additive"].append(additive) if complete: self._output["complete"].append(complete) * implement two subtabs under *Scenario Data*: *Aggregated* and *Detailed* * *Detailed* subtab shows charts with complete data, for each iteration Aggregated Detailed --------UI sketch for active "Detailed" subtab, let it be iteration 5 Aggregated Detailed

commit_message:
Forbid changing of 'cluster_id' parameter for node group

Changing of 'cluster_id' for already existing node group may lead to
unexpected behavior of nodes added to that group.

Change-Id: Ifb89758b15762600ca907c75141b6e34e9058bcd
Closes-Bug: #1531512

Support of nested properties and indexes in get_property function

Change-Id: Ib2f53047cc32a7a0913ee364f1405b8559b11f6c
Related-Bug: 1527206
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tosca-parser refs/changes/16/265716/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * { get_property: [ SELF, database_endpoint, port, 1 ] } if len(self.args) < 2: elif len(self.args) >= 3: # do not use _find_property to avoid raise KeyError # if the prop is not found # First check if there is property with this name) node_tpl = self._find_node_template(self.args[0]) props = node_tpl.get_properties() if node_tpl else [] index = 2 found = [props[self.args[1]]] if self.args[1] in props else [] if found: property_value = found[0].value else: index = 3 # then check the req or caps property_value = self._find_req_or_cap_property(self.args[1], self.args[2]) if len(self.args) > index: for elem in self.args[index:]: if isinstance(property_value, list): int_elem = int(elem) property_value = self._get_index_value(property_value, int_elem) else: property_value = self._get_attribute_value( property_value, elem) def _get_index_value(self, value, index): if isinstance(value, list): if index < len(value): return value[index] else: ExceptionCollector.appendException( KeyError(_( "Property '{0}' found in capability '{1}'" " referenced from node template {2}" " must have an element with index {3}."). format(self.args[2], self.args[1], self.context.name, index))) else: ExceptionCollector.appendException( KeyError(_( "Property '{0}' found in capability '{1}'" " referenced from node template {2}" " must be a list.").format(self.args[2], self.args[1], self.context.name))) def _get_attribute_value(self, value, attibute): if isinstance(value, dict): if attibute in value: return value[attibute] else: ExceptionCollector.appendException( KeyError(_( "Property '{0}' found in capability '{1}'" " referenced from node template {2}" " must have an attribute named {3}."). format(self.args[2], self.args[1], self.context.name, attibute))) else: ExceptionCollector.appendException( KeyError(_( "Property '{0}' found in capability '{1}'" " referenced from node template {2}" " must be a dict.").format(self.args[2], self.args[1], self.context.name))) if len(self.args) >= 3: # First check if there is property with this name node_tpl = self._find_node_template(self.args[0]) props = node_tpl.get_properties() if node_tpl else [] index = 2 found = [props[self.args[1]]] if self.args[1] in props else [] if found: property_value = found[0].value else: index = 3 # then check the req or caps property_value = self._find_req_or_cap_property(self.args[1], self.args[2]) if len(self.args) > index: for elem in self.args[index:]: if isinstance(property_value, list): int_elem = int(elem) property_value = self._get_index_value(property_value, int_elem) else: property_value = self._get_attribute_value( property_value, elem)
deleted_lines: if len(self.args) < 2 or len(self.args) > 3: elif len(self.args) == 3: get_function(self.tosca_tpl, self.context, self._find_req_or_cap_property(self.args[1], self.args[2])) else: ExceptionCollector.appendException( NotImplementedError(_( 'Nested properties are not supported.'))) if len(self.args) == 3: property_value = self._find_req_or_cap_property(self.args[1], self.args[2])

subject: VMware: specify chunk size when reading image data
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-06 13:10:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4da928de040e6053b6ae3998295b90b163893ddb', 'message': 'VMware: specify chunk size when reading image data

When reading image data from Glance without specifying chunk size,
nova-compute tries to read the entire image stream in memory which
causes out-of-memory errors. This patch fixes that by reading the image
in chunks of 64KB.

Change-Id: I953dfa1c28c25886306e1c9afe281cf2faca4db5
Closes-Bug: #1495834
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-06 13:23:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/io_util.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/71d2d31b9b86df4071c3728666842eec6cd1c727', 'message': 'VMware: specify chunk size when reading image data

When reading OVA image data from Glance without specifying chunk size,
nova-compute tries to read the entire tar stream in memory because this
is how the tar fileobject is implemented. This patch fixes this by
specifying the chunk size to be 64KB.

Change-Id: I953dfa1c28c25886306e1c9afe281cf2faca4db5
Closes-Bug: #1495834
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: specify chunk size when reading image data

When reading OVA image data from Glance without specifying chunk size,
nova-compute tries to read the entire tar stream in memory because this
is how the tar fileobject is implemented. This patch fixes this by
specifying the chunk size to be 64KB.

Change-Id: I953dfa1c28c25886306e1c9afe281cf2faca4db5
Closes-Bug: #1495834
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/68/231468/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CHUNK_SIZE = 64 * 1024 # default chunk size for image transfer data = self.input.read(CHUNK_SIZE)
deleted_lines: data = self.input.read(None)

commit_message:
Fix failed puppet run and gateway unset

Failed puppet runs now properly cause an error in the UI.

Unsetting gateway when it is the default gateway now
unsets the gateway for the host.

Change-Id: I1a281da1632ab7ef7ff9274f61933d773634b15c
Partial-Bug: #1528437

deleted_lines: import traceback log.error(traceback.print_exc()) if "err:" in output: log.error(e) return False else: log.debug(output) return True

commit_message:
Remove OpenDaylight driver

Due to a lack of tests we prefer removing the OpenDaylight driver
backport on Juno

Change-Id: Icba6bb6687c5d479df12943fef41912a0671b99e
Closes-Bug: 1533622
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/52/266852/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: =================== OpenDaylight driver =================== The **OpenDaylight** driver for the BGPVPN service plugin is designed to work jointly with the OpenDaylight SDN controller. OpenDaylight driver requires `networking-odl plugin`_ which comes with its own devstack scripts. Details on how to configure devstack for OpenDaylight plugin can be found at `networking-odl/devstack`_. * add the following to local.conf to enable networking-odl plugin:: enable_plugin networking-odl http://git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-odl * add the following to local.conf to enable ODL Driver for BGPVPN service Plugin:: NETWORKING_BGPVPN_DRIVER="BGPVPN:OpenDaylight:networking_bgpvpn.neutron.services.service_drivers.opendaylight.odl.OpenDaylightBgpvpnDriver:default" * Run stack.sh:: ./stack.sh .. _networking-odl plugin : https://launchpad.net/networking-odl .. _networking-odl/devstack : https://github.com/openstack/networking-odl/tree/master/devstack

commit_message:
Fixing amqp/https terms

The AMQP/HTTPS terms in the security-guide didn't match up with the
glossary from openstack-manuals. This patch fixes those terms.

Change-Id: Id37d02ea34255fbf9e4e7c8b72e1e1aa65fa6bd0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/security-doc refs/changes/19/266919/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: advanced message queue protocol (amqp) The Advanced Message Queuing Protocol is a protocal for handling messaging between applications and a messaging service. https Used for accessing websites over a secure connection. When used as a prefix in a URL (example: https://example.com), it instructs a client to use a secure connection for communication. This is usually done with SSL/TLS.

commit_message:
Revert "Don't die when yum fails."

This reverts commit 2babf3963f4eea8558b0c287c51e6faeb7069c70.

This breaks oslo.messaging jobs:
http://logs.openstack.org/32/265932/1/check/gate-oslo.messaging-dsvm-functional-amqp1-centos7/f5f3eb9/console.html#_2016-01-11_20_03_33_162

@kgiusti reports that PIPESTATUS[0] is always 1 on his centos7 box

Change-Id: I013c22a3545f22c79a0616b4a98622d41bb17d77
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/43/266043/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: END { exit fail }' || \ die $LINENO "Missing packages detected" # also ensure we catch a yum failure if [[ ${PIPESTATUS[0]} != 0 ]]; then die $LINENO "${YUM:-yum} install failure"
deleted_lines: END { exit fail }' result=$? if [ $result != 0 ]; then echo $LINENO "Missing packages detected" elif [[ ${PIPESTATUS[0]} != 0 ]]; then # also ensure we catch a yum failure echo $LINENO "${YUM:-yum} install failure" result=1 return $result

commit_message:
Add info about the VMware MKS console

As of the Liberty release, the VMware nova compute driver supports
a native HTML5 console called MKS.  It's a secure alternative to
VNC.

Change-Id: Ie7c979dc094691a4de3fcb19f47e3daaac10aaa2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/security-doc refs/changes/76/266576/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: VMware Native HTML5 (MKS) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The VMware compute driver supports Native HTML5 consoles as an alternative to VNC. Capabilities ------------ #. MKS is supported by the OpenStack dashboard (horizon) directly on the instance web page. This requires the *nova-mksproxy* service. #. The nova command-line utility can return a URL for an MKS console for access by a browser. Security considerations ----------------------- #. VNC support in the VMware driver suffers from race conditions on port allocations occurring between several nova-computes. This creates a possibility for allocating the same VNC port to different instances and if these instances end up on the same ESXi host somehow, one user can hijack the console of another user. This problem does not occur with WebMKS consoles. #. The *nova-mkproxy* services by default open public-facing ports that are token authenticated. #. Unlike VNC, the remote desktop traffic is encrypted. Bibliography ------------ #. OpenStack Admin Guide. MKS Console. `MKS Console <http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/compute-remote-console-access.html>`__.

commit_message:
Fix ClientException handling in Container Sync

swift/container/sync.py uses swift.common.internal_client.delete_object
and put_object and expected these methods raise ClientException.
But delete_object and put_object never raise the exception so this patch
raises ClientException when urllib2 library raises HTTPError.

Co-Authored-By: Eran Rom <eranr@il.ibm.com>
Closes-Bug: #1419901
Change-Id: I58cbf77988979a07998a46d9d81be84d29b0d9bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/06/256306/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from swift.common.exceptions import ClientExceptionfrom swift.common.utils import quote except (socket.error, httplib.HTTPException, urllib2.URLError) \ as err: if self.attempts > retries: if isinstance(err, urllib2.HTTPError): raise ClientException('Raise too many retries', http_status=err.getcode()) else: raise
deleted_lines: from swift.common.utils import quote except (socket.error, httplib.HTTPException, urllib2.URLError): if self.attempts > retries: raise

commit_message:
set selinux as security_driver for RedHat OS family

Currently Fuel puppet manifests set security_driver
in /ets/libvirt/qemu.conf as "none" on RedHat OS
family.
This patch sets security_driver value for RedHat OS
family to "selinux", this will allow to protect
vm guests from each other.
This patch does not affect Ubuntu compute nodes.

Change-Id: Iffaf2142fad25d3d50e05371fb53ab43f319c08a
Closes-bug: #1533286
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/11/266511/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: should contain_file_line('qemu_selinux').with( 'line' => 'security_driver = "selinux"',
deleted_lines: should contain_file_line('no_qemu_selinux').with( 'line' => 'security_driver = "none"',

commit_message:
Add the possibility to store several parameters for an Action

In watcher, an audit generates a set of actions which
aims at achieving a given goal (lower energy consumption, ...).
It is possible to configure different strategies in order to achieve
each goal. Each strategy is written as a Python class which produces
a set of actions. Today, the set of possible actions is fixed for a
given version of Watcher and enables optimization algorithms to
include actions such as instance migration, changing hypervisor state,
changing power state (ACPI level, ...).

This patchset add the possibility to store several parameters
for an Action.
The parameters store info that the custom Action needs.
The parameters provided as tuples with the following fields:
(parameter_name, parameter_type).

It remove also the deprecated attributes
(src,dst,description)

APIImpact
Partially implements: blueprint watcher-add-actions-via-conf

Change-Id: Ic6727341822f8ac62f212d337814b2dca76044e3

commit_message:
Replace "suspend" with "destroy" in failover cases

Snapshot with error after suspending node contains suspended node
which will be starter after dos.py revert-resume.
"Destroy" should be used in this cases.

Change-Id: If5146412bc33a74f7f7196bf496d2760c73925a7
Closes-bug:#1532748

commit_message:
Delete checks for default domain delete

Currently defualt can not be deleted through update API.
There are checks in update_domain to prevent this.

This change deletes all checks and related tests for deleting
the default domain, including new default domain and old
default domain tests.

Change-Id: I31a9cd7ac8c394b38038343f85f405080ca5f915
Closes-Bug: 1522616

commit_message:
Shrink packages list in Fuel node kickstart

Remove redundant entries from list of packages to
install on Fuel Admin node, as they are included in
the "Core" group.

Blueprint: separate-fuel-node-provisioning

Change-Id: Ie2b78fecff43f5fa63dace04849b6749c10ae6a6

commit_message:
Install Murano artifact repository for Glance

This package adds a definition of murano-specific
artifact type, which acts as an extension of Glance
v3 API, enabling it to store, process and query
murano-specific artifacts. Since Glance uses stevedore
to discover its artifact types as plugins, this type
has to be installed into the same pythonic environment
with glance-api. When the v3 is disabled if glance-api
configuration, this package is not used.

This package can be used by another applications
(not only by Murano) that's why it should be always
installed (and shouldn't depend on Murano enablement).

Depends on:
https://review.fuel-infra.org/#/c/14675/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/259483

DocImpact

Change-Id: I48cf5f00d2c9fe9324bf3d6e91ce2adb9f9ea20e
Closes-bug: #1525289
(cherry picked from commit 7f7bad1a14e95f19e0f1c2ce67467c4d0491ffa8)

commit_message:
Provide integration test_hooks to be used in gate job

Using scripts inside horizon repo in test hooks we could not bother
infra folks each time when we need to do some change to test job.

The second part of the proposed change is to run these scripts at gate,
see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/263457/

Related-Bug: #1526791
Change-Id: Ic2d60df846e876530662046d75c3e56e7841ba30
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/55/263455/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # This script will be executed inside post_test_hook function in devstack gate cd /opt/stack/new/horizon sudo -H -u stack tox -e py27integration retval=$? if [ -d openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests/integration_tests_screenshots/ ]; then cp -r openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests/integration_tests_screenshots/ /home/jenkins/workspace/gate-horizon-dsvm-integration/ fi exit $retval

commit_message:
pci: do not filter out any SRIOV Physical Functions

Stop filtering out all physical functions (PFs), preveting it from
passthough.

Partially implements blueprint sriov-physical-function-passthrough

Change-Id: I2f997ed06cd5a285e53738f05ee0c2ae47149181
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/16/249016/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(vladikr): Need to investigate if retreiving pci information # from the database is stale at this point. #if dev.get('dev_type') == fields.PciDeviceType.SRIOV_PF: # vfs_list = objects.PciDeviceList.get_by_parent_address( # context, phys_address) # if not all([vf.is_free() for vf in vfs_list]): # continue def _is_all_pf_vfs_free(self, pf): return all([dev.is_free() for dev in self.pci_devs if dev.parent_addr == pf]) def _set_hvdevs(self, devices): # Remove PFs with non-free VFs devices = [dev for dev in devices if (dev.get('dev_type') != fields.PciDeviceType.SRIOV_PF or self._is_all_pf_vfs_free(dev.get('address')))]

commit_message:
objects: update the old location parent_addr only if it has value

Do not update extra_update['phys_function'] in case parent_addr
field is None. Updating it leads to an exception as extra_update
is a dictionary of non-nullable fields.

Partially implements blueprint sriov-physical-function-passthrough

Change-Id: I8b091432f76af117d0f8d303d8b6d53ad2ca8ba3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/60/266560/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_save_empty_parent_addr(self): ctxt = context.get_admin_context() dev = pci_device.PciDevice._from_db_object( ctxt, pci_device.PciDevice(), fake_db_dev) dev.parent_addr = None with mock.patch.object(db, 'pci_device_update', return_value=fake_db_dev) as update_mock: dev.save() self.assertIsNone(dev.parent_addr) self.assertEqual({}, dev.extra_info)

commit_message:
Enable changing list of inspection collectors

Inspection collectors are IPA plugins that collect additional information
for inspection. This patch allow changing their list, with default remaining
the same (for now).

Change-Id: I1e5ea1cd5ee24872375cd53d3eebf14b1082d874

subject: Fix the wrong options in glance-api and glance-registry confs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-13 00:57:02.000000000', 'files': ['etc/glance-api.conf', 'etc/glance-registry.conf'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/ca5cdb59e136a54862f8132bc5b3f9867ae44390', 'message': 'Fix the wrong options in glance-api and glance-registry confs

OSprofiler arguments do not have "profiler" group which makes
these config files wrong.

However they are used by DevStack, so this patch updates them
using:

   tox -e genconfig

Change-Id: Ia18ec3e7b2e94d0a0ba6cb8562a0b457fb5ef406
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the wrong options in glance-api and glance-registry confs

OSprofiler arguments do not have "profiler" group which makes
these config files wrong.

However they are used by DevStack, so this patch updates them
using:

   tox -e genconfig

Change-Id: Ia18ec3e7b2e94d0a0ba6cb8562a0b457fb5ef406
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/20/266620/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # security risk, so use this setting with caution! Setting this to # true overrides the show_image_direct_url option. This option is ignored if # log_config_append is set. (list value) #default_log_levels = amqp=WARN,amqplib=WARN,boto=WARN,qpid=WARN,sqlalchemy=WARN,suds=INFO,oslo.messaging=INFO,iso8601=WARN,requests.packages.urllib3.connectionpool=WARN,urllib3.connectionpool=WARN,websocket=WARN,requests.packages.urllib3.util.retry=WARN,urllib3.util.retry=WARN,keystonemiddleware=WARN,routes.middleware=WARN,stevedore=WARN,taskflow=WARN,keystoneauth=WARN# Format string for user_identity field of the # logging_context_format_string (string value) #logging_user_identity_format = %(user)s %(tenant)s %(domain)s %(user_domain)s %(project_domain)s #rpc_zmq_matchmaker = redis # Type of concurrency used. Either "native" or "eventlet" (string # value) #rpc_zmq_concurrency = eventlet# The default number of seconds that poll should wait. Poll raises # timeout exception when timeout expired. (integer value) #rpc_poll_timeout = 1 # Configures zmq-messaging to use proxy with non PUB/SUB patterns. # (boolean value) #direct_over_proxy = true # Use PUB/SUB pattern for fanout methods. PUB/SUB always uses proxy. # (boolean value) #use_pub_sub = true # Minimal port number for random ports range. (port value) # Minimum value: 1 # Maximum value: 65535 #rpc_zmq_min_port = 49152 # Maximal port number for random ports range. (integer value) # Minimum value: 1 # Maximum value: 65536 #rpc_zmq_max_port = 65536 # Number of retries to find free port number before fail with # ZMQBindError. (integer value) #rpc_zmq_bind_port_retries = 100 # Host to locate redis. (string value) #host = 127.0.0.1 # Use this port to connect to redis host. (port value) # Minimum value: 1 # Maximum value: 65535 #port = 6379 # Password for Redis server (optional). (string value) #password =# Deprecated group/name - [DEFAULT]/notification_driver #driver = # A URL representing the messaging driver to use for notifications. If # not set, we fall back to the same configuration used for RPC. # (string value) # Deprecated group/name - [DEFAULT]/notification_transport_url #transport_url = <None># Deprecated group/name - [DEFAULT]/notification_topics #topics = notifications# include amqp and zmq. (string value)# Timeout value (in seconds) used when connecting to ceph cluster. If # value <= 0, no timeout is set and default librados value is used. # (integer value) #rados_connect_timeout = 0 # The host where the S3 server is listening. (string value) #s3_store_host = <None> # The S3 query token access key. (string value) #s3_store_access_key = <None> # The S3 query token secret key. (string value) #s3_store_secret_key = <None> # The S3 bucket to be used to store the Glance data. (string value) #s3_store_bucket = <None> # The local directory where uploads will be staged before they are # transferred into S3. (string value) #s3_store_object_buffer_dir = <None> # A boolean to determine if the S3 bucket should be created on upload # if it does not exist or if an error should be returned to the user. # (boolean value) #s3_store_create_bucket_on_put = false # The S3 calling format used to determine the bucket. Either subdomain # or path can be used. (string value) #s3_store_bucket_url_format = subdomain # What size, in MB, should S3 start chunking image files and do a # multipart upload in S3. (integer value) #s3_store_large_object_size = 100 # What multipart upload part size, in MB, should S3 use when uploading # parts. The size must be greater than or equal to 5M. (integer value) #s3_store_large_object_chunk_size = 10 # The number of thread pools to perform a multipart upload in S3. # (integer value) #s3_store_thread_pools = 10 # Enable the use of a proxy. (boolean value) #s3_store_enable_proxy = false # Address or hostname for the proxy server. (string value) #s3_store_proxy_host = <None> # The port to use when connecting over a proxy. (integer value) #s3_store_proxy_port = 8080 # The username to connect to the proxy. (string value) #s3_store_proxy_user = <None> # The password to use when connecting over a proxy. (string value) #s3_store_proxy_password = <None> # If True, swiftclient won't check for a valid SSL certificate when # authenticating. (boolean value) #swift_store_auth_insecure = false # A string giving the CA certificate file to use in SSL connections # for verifying certs. (string value) #swift_store_cacert = <None> # The region of the swift endpoint to be used for single tenant. This # setting is only necessary if the tenant has multiple swift # endpoints. (string value) #swift_store_region = <None> # If set, the configured endpoint will be used. If None, the storage # url from the auth response will be used. (string value) #swift_store_endpoint = <None> # A string giving the endpoint type of the swift service to use # (publicURL, adminURL or internalURL). This setting is only used if # swift_store_auth_version is 2. (string value) #swift_store_endpoint_type = publicURL # A string giving the service type of the swift service to use. This # setting is only used if swift_store_auth_version is 2. (string # value) #swift_store_service_type = object-store # Container within the account that the account should use for storing # images in Swift when using single container mode. In multiple # container mode, this will be the prefix for all containers. (string # value) #swift_store_container = glance # The size, in MB, that Glance will start chunking image files and do # a large object manifest in Swift. (integer value) #swift_store_large_object_size = 5120 # The amount of data written to a temporary disk buffer during the # process of chunking the image file. (integer value) #swift_store_large_object_chunk_size = 200 # A boolean value that determines if we create the container if it # does not exist. (boolean value) #swift_store_create_container_on_put = false # If set to True, enables multi-tenant storage mode which causes # Glance images to be stored in tenant specific Swift accounts. # (boolean value) #swift_store_multi_tenant = false # When set to 0, a single-tenant store will only use one container to # store all images. When set to an integer value between 1 and 32, a # single-tenant store will use multiple containers to store images, # and this value will determine how many containers are created.Used # only when swift_store_multi_tenant is disabled. The total number of # containers that will be used is equal to 16^N, so if this config # option is set to 2, then 16^2=256 containers will be used to store # images. (integer value) #swift_store_multiple_containers_seed = 0 # A list of tenants that will be granted read/write access on all # Swift containers created by Glance in multi-tenant mode. (list # value) #swift_store_admin_tenants = # If set to False, disables SSL layer compression of https swift # requests. Setting to False may improve performance for images which # are already in a compressed format, eg qcow2. (boolean value) #swift_store_ssl_compression = true # The number of times a Swift download will be retried before the # request fails. revisions:

commit_message:
Remove systemd-container workaround for docker

Since centos:centos7 image was updated in upstream we don't need
systemd workarounds anymore

Change-Id: Ie3f30def2f43fdf75e48438e294bc94c00e4e60a
Closes-bug: #1532773
(cherry picked from commit 1471117be34a1e43ad8dbe43e77fd395df49831e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/69/265869/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # TODO(dteselkin): 'yum swap' was added to fix systemd-container* update issue. # systemd-container* packages were deprecated and cannot be # upgraded. They should be removed in a new docker image built # from scratch. After that this line can be safely removed. RUN yum --disablerepo=* --enablerepo=C_CENTOS_RELEASE_-base --enablerepo=C_CENTOS_RELEASE_-extras --enablerepo=C_CENTOS_RELEASE_-updates -y swap -- remove systemd-container systemd-container-libs -- install systemd systemd-libs

commit_message:
Clean up erroneous log messages

* Return false on network.inSameSubnet if any IP is None
* Improve menu highlighting to only target urwid.Button elements
  to avoid errors in logs
* Remove bootproto debug output in PXE Setup
* Improve wording about disabling NTP when there is no gateway

Change-Id: I521326e45a356211d067f45fa91d911964d9784b
Closes-Bug: #1528561

subject: Move Q_USE_SECGROUP for complete support of external plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-25 00:58:20.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/nec', 'lib/neutron_plugins/vmware_nsx_v3', 'lib/neutron_plugins/midonet', 'lib/neutron_plugins/vmware_nsx', 'lib/neutron_plugins/vmware_nsx_v', 'lib/neutron_plugins/vmware_dvs', 'lib/neutron-legacy'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/a031c964ebb5c108b041bd4b289aae401d9f1cde', 'message': 'Move Q_USE_SECGROUP for complete support of external plugin

Even after devstack external plugin mechanism was introduced,
Neutron plugin maintainers still need to have small code
in the main devstack repo.
It is because has_neutron_plugin_security_group is called too
early, i.e. before loading external plugin.

This commit defers the call of has_neutron_plugin_security_group
until configure_neutron. After that, devstack external plugin
suport for Neutorn is completely achieved.

This patch also deletes vendor specific files which already use
external plugin (midonet, nec, vmware_*).
I checked all these repositories and confirmed they have
has_neutron_plugin_security_group function in their repo too.
We can safely delete these files.

Change-Id: If7b8f6fa674773ce131abb9b78fd392688c23254
'}]
commit_message:
Move Q_USE_SECGROUP for complete support of external plugin

Even after devstack external plugin mechanism was introduced,
Neutron plugin maintainers still need to have small code
in the main devstack repo.
It is because has_neutron_plugin_security_group is called too
early, i.e. before loading external plugin.

This commit defers the call of has_neutron_plugin_security_group
until configure_neutron. After that, devstack external plugin
suport for Neutorn is completely achieved.

This patch also deletes vendor specific files which already use
external plugin (midonet, nec, vmware_*).
I checked all these repositories and confirmed they have
has_neutron_plugin_security_group function in their repo too.
We can safely delete these files.

Change-Id: If7b8f6fa674773ce131abb9b78fd392688c23254
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/20/227620/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Use security group or not. If plugin does not support it, fallback to False. Q_USE_SECGROUP=${Q_USE_SECGROUP:-True} # Disalbe Q_USE_SECGROUP if plugin has no support of security group. if ! has_neutron_plugin_security_group; then Q_USE_SECGROUP=False fi
deleted_lines: # Use security group or not if has_neutron_plugin_security_group; then Q_USE_SECGROUP=${Q_USE_SECGROUP:-True} else Q_USE_SECGROUP=False fi

commit_message:
Add reviewing point related to REST API

Since I8ad9313f824ef656c841a9b60ee575f02ddea321, the api-wg has
introduced a new guideline. That was based on Nova's development
experience, and this patch adds it as a reviewing point for making
consistent APIs.

Change-Id: I53c4055d973b6f76fca16ae170d0df9e1829fca5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/45/266645/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

The CFG module now supports min and max values. This is validated
when the configuration file is read. This change enables us to do
the validation of the 'scheduler_max_attempts' at init rather

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Id44fa9299d509a61f586e843cac485a00f2af032
"}]
commit_message:
Scheduler: enforce max attempts at service startup

The CFG module now supports min and max values. This is validated
when the configuration file is read. This change enables us to do
the validation of the 'scheduler_max_attempts' at init rather
than when an instance is being booted.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Id44fa9299d509a61f586e843cac485a00f2af032
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/45/265645/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add xenapi support for XenapiLiveMigrateData objects

This makes the xenapi driver use an object for source, dest, and
pre-live migration checks. Like the libvirt patch before this,
actually tolerating an object in live_migration will come in a
following patch, because $reasons.

Note that this corrects the migration result of the fake xenapi
driver, which was returning a string instead of a dict, as the
real call would have.

Related to blueprint objectify-live-migrate-data

Change-Id: I0d5e9448ec782741ebec6fd67d2c8b01ebdafde1

commit_message:
Set None explicitly to filter options.

When user set None in query string value
'None' was set instead of None.

Note: This fix is for mongodb only. I will
add another patch for other database.

Partial-Bug: #1388680
Change-Id: I2f42013b9c8fb9a3af9d6366f10dd8bb3906d73a

is better. This patch fixes it.

commit_message:
Fix server admin password usage

Nova returns "adminPass" in create server response only if
CONF.enable_instance_password is True.
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py#L688

Tempest-lib servers_client and its schema take care of those but in
tempest it is not taken care. Test case always expect "adminPass"
which is being further used for ssh etc.

If any environment has CONF.enable_instance_password as False then
attribute error will occur.

Test case should pass password while creating server and use that for
further usage instead of expecting admin password from create server
response.

Closes-Bug: #1528445

Change-Id: I745f3f8c0c8bee05db85af5e91fbb60b0a54bcec

commit_message:
Fix the password input

When validate the authentication after rebuild, the new password
should be used. And the paramiko lib will check both key pair or
user/password at the same time.

Change-Id: I5efd55de6552db8269f5efbbca1397e49d81547f
Closes-bug: #1530783
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/15/263215/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Authentication is attempted in the following order of priority: # 1.The key passed in, if one was passed in. # 2.Any key we can find through an SSH agent (if allowed). # 3.Any "id_rsa", "id_dsa" or "id_ecdsa" key discoverable in # ~/.ssh/ (if allowed). # 4.Plain username/password auth, if a password was given. password,

added_lines: # Eugen Block , 2016. #zanata"POT-Creation-Date: 2016-01-13 03:52+0000 ""PO-Revision-Date: 2016-01-12 03:14+0000 " "Last-Translator: Eugen Block ""Der Datenträgertyp ist ein Typ oder eine Bezeichnung, " "die bei der Erstellung des Datenträgers in OpenStack ausgewählt werden " "kann. commit_message:
Add resolve_outputs parameter to stack get method

Also add --no-resolve-outputs parameter to heat stack-show command
to let user get stack without outputs.

@APIImpact, @DOCImpact
Depends-On: I03104efc535a7bd4326cbec56c01cd887db38ab6

Change-Id: I6c715fe90e42259e744b76924673194d0a81c07e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/77/263377/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.arg('--resolve-outputs', default=None, metavar='<VALUE>', help='Resolves and print outputs if set to True') if args.resolve_outputs is not None: resolve_outputs = strutils.bool_from_string(args.resolve_outputs, strict=True) else: resolve_outputs = True fields = {'stack_id': args.id, 'resolve_outputs': resolve_outputs}
deleted_lines: fields = {'stack_id': args.id}

commit_message:
Fix service_type for Sahara

Currently we are using wrong service_type for Sahara, it was introduced
because of bug in Tempest in upstream during Kilo cycle and now
this bug is fixed and we should use proper service_type as well.

Change-Id: I890cf8bb8e15b568e72f42327c22ed4d852ea6e4
Closes-bug: #1356053

commit_message:
Add rspec-puppet-facts to the spec_helper

This change adds the rspec-puppet-facts gem to the spec helper so that
we can centralize the management of the base operating systems that we
support. rspec-puppet-facts allows us to simplify our unit tests and
provides a more complete list of Operating Systems and their associated
facts for the unit tests.  With this change we can now loop over and
test CentOS, Debian, Fedora, RedHat, and Ubuntu by simply providing a
list of supported os to rspec-puppet-facts.

Additionally this change includes a central object for managing our
supported os list for rspec-puppet-facts and providing our default facts
like os_service_default. This central object should replace the usage of
@default_facts within the unit tests for each module.

Change-Id: I5e91cec849886e5320e1e2a264af66c5b8bfe95c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/54/264554/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This file contains a module to return a default set of facts and supported # operating systems for the tests in this module. module OSDefaults def self.get_facts(extra_facts={}) { :os_service_default => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' }.merge(extra_facts) end def self.get_supported_os [ { "operatingsystem" => "CentOS", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "6.0", "7.0" ] }, { "operatingsystem" => "RedHat", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "6.0", "7.0" ] }, { "operatingsystem" => "Ubuntu", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "12.04", "14.04" ] }, { "operatingsystem" => "Debian", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "7", "8" ] } ] end end

commit_message:
Fix horizon caching backend for UCA

This change updates the horizon caching backend to be configurable and
changes the default where os_package_default is either not present or is
set to debian. The MOS package provides an alternate memcache backend
that is not available from other groups. With this change, we can now
specify a cache_backend as part of the horizon configuration hash which
will be used instead of the defaults specified in code.

Change-Id: If1050db4bb54bc9f3ae355ffeb2ae7fbeb3cfc44
Related-Blueprint: deploy-with-uca-packages
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/69/264369/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(aschultz): the horizon.backends.memcached.HorizonMemcached is only part # of the MOS package set. This should be contributed upstream and then we can # use this as the default. if $::os_package_type == 'debian' { $horizon_cache_backend = try_get_value($horizon_hash, 'cache_backend', 'horizon.backends.memcached.HorizonMemcached') } else { $horizon_cache_backend = try_get_value($horizon_hash, 'cache_backend', 'django.core.cache.backends.memcached.MemcachedCache') } cache_backend => $horizon_cache_backend,
deleted_lines: cache_backend => 'horizon.backends.memcached.HorizonMemcached',

commit_message:
Add rspec-puppet-facts to the spec_helper

This change adds the rspec-puppet-facts gem to the spec helper so that
we can centralize the management of the base operating systems that we
support. rspec-puppet-facts allows us to simplify our unit tests and
provides a more complete list of Operating Systems and their associated
facts for the unit tests.  With this change we can now loop over and
test CentOS, Debian, Fedora, RedHat, and Ubuntu by simply providing a
list of supported os to rspec-puppet-facts.

Additionally this change includes a central object for managing our
supported os list for rspec-puppet-facts and providing our default facts
like os_service_default. This central object should replace the usage of
@default_facts within the unit tests for each module.

Change-Id: I7eb1f4fdb413fa25a2560f65d17419efacf5c836
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack_extras refs/changes/56/264556/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This file contains a module to return a default set of facts and supported # operating systems for the tests in this module. module OSDefaults def self.get_facts(extra_facts={}) { :os_service_default => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' }.merge(extra_facts) end def self.get_supported_os [ { "operatingsystem" => "CentOS", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "6.0", "7.0" ] }, { "operatingsystem" => "RedHat", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "6.0", "7.0" ] }, { "operatingsystem" => "Ubuntu", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "12.04", "14.04" ] }, { "operatingsystem" => "Debian", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "7", "8" ] } ] end end

commit_message:
Upgrade requirements for compatibility with Keystone

In order to have the monasca client as part of the global requirements
all the packages conflicts need to be resolved.

Keystone is using a new version of oslo.util and monasca client
has to adopt it too.

Change-Id: I55f827ec3e922dfdd4dcaeb2d43762465421f1fa

commit_message:
Sometimes prepare messages are delayed

This bug addresses one issue which manifests itself as a delayed
deliver of prepare messages on the guest. A full description of the
change is found in the bug report along with a set of sample programs
to recreate the problem and test the fix.

I'm marking this as 'partial-bug' only because I'm not sure this is
the only issue that can cause this. It is just that this one is
certainly the one that has been plaguing me on my dev environment.

Change-Id: I065fb7c7f674ce587d4a480ac2f3462826ba2604
Partial-Bug: #1511623

commit_message:
Disallow disabling the default domain

Currently default domain can be disabled through domain update API.
There is nothing in the update domain flow that protects against
disabling the default domain.

This change checks that default domain can not be disabled.
Test cases include checking disabling default domain, any new default domain,
and old default domain.

Change-Id: I918841af87f23ea7eedc788ff7a4e0d6ac64ed00
Closes-Bug: 1522616

commit_message:
Code refactoring for CDH plugin

CDH plugin contains many duplicated code. We need to do some
refactor to the code to allow easier support to new versions in
future.

Change-Id: Ifa47636b6feadcaea50e794560e13dc95a6b2013
implements: blueprint cdh-plugin-refactoring
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-specs refs/changes/93/245193/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =============================== Code refactoring for CDH plugin =============================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara/+spec/cdh-plugin-refactoring This spec is to do some refactor to the code to allow easier support to new versions in future. Problem description =================== CDH plugin contains many duplicated code. Current implemention extracts some general and base behavior of th plugin, and each version has it's own implemention for something not included in base classes and modules. But there are many overlaps between versions because of the downward compatibility. For example, sahara.plugins.cdh.v5.db_helper extends sahara.plugins.cdh.db_helper, but functions such as get_hive_db_password are writed again in sahara.plugins.cdh.v5_3_0.db_helper. And currently the low test coverage of CDH plugin mades it hard to guarantee the quality of the new code after refactor. So some new unit test cases need to be added. And some old test cases may be altered according to refactor. Proposed change =============== Considering the features of relations between different versions of plugin, we may let a new version extends a old one instead of all extends from base. This design can well support the downward compatibility. For some deprecations or changes in new version, just overide it. And should keep them looks the same as before from ouside. As for some modules such as db_helper, again, only provides functions to be called by other modules. To be better extends, we may encapsulate them into a class. Example of ClouderaUtils for CDH plugin:: class ClouderaUtilsV5(cu.ClouderaUtils): #do something class ClouderaUtilsV530(ClouderaUtilsV5): #do something Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Deployer impact --------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Sahara-image-elements impact ---------------------------- None Sahara-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: jxwang Work Items ---------- This will require following changes: * Change the relation between versions of plugins and delete duplicated codes. Classes need to be modified: sahara/plugin/cdh/version/cloudera_utils.py: ClouderaUtils sahara/plugin/cdh/version/edp_engine.py: EdpOozieEngine, EdpSparkEngine sahara/plugin/cdh/version/plugin_utils.py: PluginUtils sahara/plugin/cdh/version/versionhandler.py: VersionHandler * Functions in modules need to be encapsulate into class: sahara/plugin/cdh/version/config_helper.py: sahara/plugin/cdh/version/db_helper.py: sahara/plugin/cdh/version/deploy.py: sahara/plugin/cdh/version/validation.py: * Add unit test case for low covered modules. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= None Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

commit_message:
UI: Enable CSS use in mistral dashboard

* Removed non-working implementation of LESS (scss to css compiler)
* Removed redundant unused styles
* Added CSS support - the same way they do in Murano Dashboard
* We could always add LESS and Django intergration later,
  seems it only works in static folders inside the Horizon respository ATM.

Closes-Bug: 1512377

Change-Id: Ic1f239c103382e780df754ff8fac4b6374ef33cb

commit_message:
Add rspec-puppet-facts to the spec_helper

This change adds the rspec-puppet-facts gem to the spec helper so that
we can centralize the management of the base operating systems that we
support. rspec-puppet-facts allows us to simplify our unit tests and
provides a more complete list of Operating Systems and their associated
facts for the unit tests.  With this change we can now loop over and
test CentOS, Debian, Fedora, RedHat, and Ubuntu by simply providing a
list of supported os to rspec-puppet-facts.

Additionally this change includes a central object for managing our
supported os list for rspec-puppet-facts and providing our default facts
like os_service_default. This central object should replace the usage of
@default_facts within the unit tests for each module.

Change-Id: Id6357ffb1a47ea78760e4af181da3797d7ec8fe8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/41/264541/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This file contains a module to return a default set of facts and supported # operating systems for the tests in this module. module OSDefaults def self.get_facts(extra_facts={}) { :os_service_default => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' }.merge(extra_facts) end def self.get_supported_os [ { "operatingsystem" => "CentOS", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "6.0", "7.0" ] }, { "operatingsystem" => "RedHat", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "6.0", "7.0" ] }, { "operatingsystem" => "Ubuntu", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "12.04", "14.04" ] }, { "operatingsystem" => "Debian", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "7", "8" ] } ] end end

commit_message:
Opening a repository for a ceilometer plugin for collectd.

- This change creates a new repo to host a collectd
  writer plugin to publish telemetry to ceilometer.
- This plugin will utilise the collectd python plugin
  interface to integrate with collectd.
- This repository will be extended to provide in tree
  documentation and devstack integration.

Change-Id: I33c077ae3b52a63f60980ebf757c51e3f41abd82

(string # value) #filesystem_store_metadata_file = <None> # The required permission for created image file. In this way the user # other service used, e.g. Nova, who consumes the image could be the # exclusive member of the group that owns the files created. Assigning # it less then or equal to zero means don't change the default # permission of the file. This value will be decoded as an octal # digit. (integer value) #filesystem_store_file_perm = 0 # RADOS images will be chunked into objects of this size (in # megabytes). For best performance, this should be a power of two. # (integer value) #rbd_store_chunk_size = 8 # RADOS pool in which images are stored. (string value) #rbd_store_pool = images # RADOS user to authenticate as (only applicable if using Cephx. If # <None>, a default will be chosen based on the client. section in # rbd_store_ceph_conf) (string value) #rbd_store_user = <None> # Ceph configuration file path. If <None>, librados will locate the # default config. If using cephx authentication, this file should # include a reference to the right keyring in a client.<USER> section # (string value) #rbd_store_ceph_conf = /etc/ceph/ceph.conf # Timeout value (in seconds) used when connecting to ceph cluster. If # value <= 0, no timeout is set and default librados value is used. # (integer value) #rados_connect_timeout = 0 # Hostname or IP address of the instance to connect to, or a mongodb # URI, or a list of hostnames / mongodb URIs. If host is an IPv6 # literal it must be enclosed in '[' and ']' characters following the # RFC2732 URL syntax (e.g. '[::1]' for localhost) (string value) #mongodb_store_uri = <None> # Database to use (string value) #mongodb_store_db = <None> # The host where the S3 server is listening. (string value) #s3_store_host = <None> # The S3 query token access key. (string value) #s3_store_access_key = <None> # The S3 query token secret key. (string value) #s3_store_secret_key = <None> # The S3 bucket to be used to store the Glance data. (string value) #s3_store_bucket = <None> # The local directory where uploads will be staged before they are # transferred into S3. (string value) #s3_store_object_buffer_dir = <None> # A boolean to determine if the S3 bucket should be created on upload # if it does not exist or if an error should be returned to the user. # (boolean value) #s3_store_create_bucket_on_put = false # The S3 calling format used to determine the bucket. Either subdomain # or path can be used. (string value) #s3_store_bucket_url_format = subdomain # What size, in MB, should S3 start chunking image files and do a # multipart upload in S3. (integer value) #s3_store_large_object_size = 100 # What multipart upload part size, in MB, should S3 use when uploading # parts. The size must be greater than or equal to 5M. (integer value) #s3_store_large_object_chunk_size = 10 # The number of thread pools to perform a multipart upload in S3. # (integer value) #s3_store_thread_pools = 10 # Enable the use of a proxy. (boolean value) #s3_store_enable_proxy = false # Address or hostname for the proxy server. (string value) #s3_store_proxy_host = <None> # The port to use when connecting over a proxy. (integer value) #s3_store_proxy_port = 8080 # The username to connect to the proxy. (string value) #s3_store_proxy_user = <None> # The password to use when connecting over a proxy. (string value) #s3_store_proxy_password = <None> # ESX/ESXi or vCenter Server target system. The server value can be an # IP address or a DNS name. (string value) #vmware_server_host = <None> # Username for authenticating with VMware ESX/VC server. (string # value) #vmware_server_username = <None> # Password for authenticating with VMware ESX/VC server. (string # value) #vmware_server_password = <None> # DEPRECATED. Inventory path to a datacenter. If the # vmware_server_host specified is an ESX/ESXi, the # vmware_datacenter_path is optional. If specified, it should be "ha- # datacenter". This option is deprecated in favor of vmware_datastores # and will be removed in the Liberty release. (string value) # This option is deprecated for removal. # Its value may be silently ignored in the future. #vmware_datacenter_path = ha-datacenter # DEPRECATED. Datastore associated with the datacenter. This option is # deprecated in favor of vmware_datastores and will be removed in the # Liberty release. (string value) # This option is deprecated for removal. # Its value may be silently ignored in the future. #vmware_datastore_name = <None> # Number of times VMware ESX/VC server API must be retried upon # connection related issues. (integer value) #vmware_api_retry_count = 10 # The interval used for polling remote tasks invoked on VMware ESX/VC # server. (integer value) #vmware_task_poll_interval = 5 # The name of the directory where the glance images will be stored in # the VMware datastore. (string value) #vmware_store_image_dir = /openstack_glance # Allow to perform insecure SSL requests to ESX/VC. (boolean value) #vmware_api_insecure = false # A list of datastores where the image can be stored. This option may # be specified multiple times for specifying multiple datastores. # Either one of vmware_datastore_name or vmware_datastores is # required. The datastore name should be specified after its # datacenter path, seperated by ":". An optional weight may be given # after the datastore name, seperated again by ":". Thus, the required # format becomes <datacenter_path>:<datastore_name>:<optional_weight>. # When adding an image, the datastore with highest weight will be # selected, unless there is not enough free space available in cases # where the image size is already known. If no weight is given, it is # assumed to be zero and the directory will be considered for # selection last. If multiple datastores have the same weight, then # the one with the most free space available is selected. (multi # valued) #vmware_datastores = # Info to match when looking for cinder in the service catalog. Format # is : separated values of the form: # <service_type>:<service_name>:<endpoint_type> (string value) #cinder_catalog_info = volume:cinder:publicURL # Override service catalog lookup with template for cinder endpoint # e.g. http://localhost:8776/v1/%(project_id)s (string value) #cinder_endpoint_template = <None> # Region name of this node (string value) #os_region_name = <None> # Location of ca certicates file to use for cinder client requests. # (string value) #cinder_ca_certificates_file = <None> # Number of cinderclient retries on failed http calls (integer value) #cinder_http_retries = 3 # Allow to perform insecure SSL requests to cinder (boolean value) #cinder_api_insecure = false # Authentication type to load (unknown value) # Deprecated group/name - [DEFAULT]/auth_plugin #auth_type = <None> # Config Section from which to load plugin specific options (unknown # value) #auth_section = <None> #password =# Space separated list of acceptable SASL mechanisms (string value) # Deprecated group/name - [amqp1]/sasl_mechanisms #sasl_mechanisms = # Path to directory that contains the SASL configuration (string # value) # Deprecated group/name - [amqp1]/sasl_config_dir #sasl_config_dir = # Name of configuration file (without .conf suffix) (string value) # Deprecated group/name - [amqp1]/sasl_config_name #sasl_config_name = # User name for message broker authentication (string value) # Deprecated group/name - [amqp1]/username #username = # Password for message broker authentication (string value) # Deprecated group/name - [amqp1]/password #password = [profiler] # # From glance.registry # # If False fully disable profiling feature. (boolean value) #enabled = false # If False doesn't trace SQL requests. (boolean value) #trace_sqlalchemy = false # Secret key to use to sign Glance API and Glance Registry services # tracing messages. (string value) #hmac_keys = SECRET_KEY

commit_message:
Migrate verify-tempest-config to new cliff cli framework

Leave existing endpoint for now as to not disrupt existing
workflows and deprecate next cycle.

Added deprecation message for old entry point.

Change-Id: If8afab441f51e5cf0f3bf1e2b95d76b2c1d0c474
Implements: blueprint tempest-cli-improvements

commit_message:
Replace deprecated library function os.popen() with subprocess

os.popen() is deprecated since python 2.6. Resolved with use of
subprocess module.

Change-Id: I8cfbf8dbd6b318303f5ea368f4ce3b907e244151
Closes-Bug: #1529836

deleted_lines: git_cmd = "/usr/bin/git log | head -n1 | cut -f2 -d' '" gitsha = os.popen(git_cmd).read().strip('\n')

commit_message:
Add rspec-puppet-facts to the spec_helper

This change adds the rspec-puppet-facts gem to the spec helper so that
we can centralize the management of the base operating systems that we
support. rspec-puppet-facts allows us to simplify our unit tests and
provides a more complete list of Operating Systems and their associated
facts for the unit tests.  With this change we can now loop over and
test CentOS, Debian, Fedora, RedHat, and Ubuntu by simply providing a
list of supported os to rspec-puppet-facts.

Additionally this change includes a central object for managing our
supported os list for rspec-puppet-facts and providing our default facts
like os_service_default. This central object should replace the usage of
@default_facts within the unit tests for each module.

Change-Id: I977b9f2fd1558d45128d8a0bd161faba982dda4e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-aodh refs/changes/38/264538/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This file contains a module to return a default set of facts and supported # operating systems for the tests in this module. module OSDefaults def self.get_facts(extra_facts={}) { :os_service_default => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' }.merge(extra_facts) end def self.get_supported_os [ { "operatingsystem" => "CentOS", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "6.0", "7.0" ] }, { "operatingsystem" => "RedHat", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "6.0", "7.0" ] }, { "operatingsystem" => "Ubuntu", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "12.04", "14.04" ] }, { "operatingsystem" => "Debian", "operatingsystemrelease" => [ "7", "8" ] } ] end end

commit_message:
Add rspec-puppet-facts to the spec_helper

This change adds the rspec-puppet-facts gem to the spec helper so that
we can centralize the management of the base operating systems that we
support. rspec-puppet-facts allows us to simplify our unit tests and
provides a more complete list of Operating Systems and their associated
facts for the unit tests.  With this change we can now loop over and
test CentOS, Debian, Fedora, RedHat, and Ubuntu by simply providing a
list of supported os to rspec-puppet-facts.

Additionally this change includes a central object for managing our
supported os list for rspec-puppet-facts and providing our default facts
like os_service_default. This central object should replace the usage of
@default_facts within the unit tests for each module.

Change-Id: Id4f384ab9e50c0cf9fe638cab50374c21844ca36
