commit_message:
Transfer table should update allocatedIds on allocated change

Transfer table does a one time allocation
for allocatedIds and does not watch changes to
allocated. As a result, when the allocated
list is fetched at a later point, the allocatedIds
are not updated resulting in a broken view.

Partially-Implements: blueprint ng-flavors
Closes-Bug: #1531334

Change-Id: I807c682b69081f90fc3d74675e8ca149bb855521
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/05/252205/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $scope.$watchCollection(getAllocated, onAllocatedChange); } function getAllocated() { return ctrl.allocated.sourceItems; } function onAllocatedChange() { angular.forEach(ctrl.allocated.sourceItems, function(item) { ctrl.allocatedIds[item.id] = true; });

commit_message:
Create V9 version of resource driver interface

In preparation for projects acting as domains (which will result
in driver interface changes), a V9 version of the resource
interface is created, along with the wrapper support scaffolding
for V8 drivers.

Partially Implements: blueprint reseller

Change-Id: Iec6f7fe2347b64c8f721e968b816e6c1b4332d0a

commit_message:
Create a ISO Date Time Filter

The filter converts the string date into ISO-8610 format,
which adds proper UTC timezone identifier which can then
be used by Angular.

Dates returned by various API may be in date formats other
than ISO. This filter converts them to ISO Dates which can
then be processed by standard Angular filters as documentated on
https://docs.angularjs.org/api/ng/filter/date

Partially implements: bp ng-hypervisors

Change-Id: I97210b3c25927285cbbadb1d07ede241226bd46d

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.
This problem has been solved on Tempest already.
This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: Idc78db1c788b3d611bec980b44b21d56afc864ac
Closes-Bug: #1465086
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qa-specs refs/changes/28/252128/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: passenv = http_proxy HTTP_PROXY https_proxy HTTPS_PROXY no_proxy NO_PROXY

commit_message:
VMware LBaaSv1 method uses invalid context

VMware LBaaSv1 driver supplies the Neutron plugin with a method, which allows
detection of Edge appliance use by the LBaaS driver.
The is_edge_in_use() method is using a context which is invalid: the driver
has no self.context property and shouldn't have one.
Instead, the context should pass as parameter.

Change-Id: I7f3b95b43f87b35d641f0c7535d648ee178eda41
Closes-Bug: #1521160
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/20/251320/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: def is_edge_in_use(self, edge_id): pool_mappings = db.get_nsxv_edge_pool_mapping_by_edge( self.context, edge_id)

commit_message:
Replaces __builtin__ with six.moves.builtins

__builtin__ does not exist in Python 3. Replacing it with
six.moves.builtins will ensure compatibility with both Python 2.7
and Python 3.4.

Change-Id: Id185ee8331e69b534d43f6898e2c2163dbd99425

commit_message:
Move rtr_fip_subnet initialization up to create_dvr_fip_interfaces

This was suggested as part of another review here [1].  I think I've
captured Assaf's reasoning here but I haven't yet thought it through.
So, this will be marked WIP for now.  I also haven't done anything
with the tests (obviously) and expect some will fail.

[1] https://goo.gl/KFnG5i

commit_message:
not always restart dnsmasq when dhcp-agnet restart

Current code will refresh dnsmasq configure files and
restart dnsmasq process when dhcp-agent restart, even
nothing changed to neutron network.

It seems unnecessary to restart dnsmasq there is no
changing to dnsmasq configures, if nothing changed
happened to neutron network.

Closes-bug: #1496844
Change-Id: I18ac5bf3388116595d157b64ad265f56c2c1ff73

commit_message:
Leverage new neutronresources table to simplify RBAC

This patch migrates the networkrbacs table to a generic
resourcerbacs table which greatly simplifies the lookup
of RBAC entries for networks and any future objects.

Change-Id: I702232cfc9848288b80443bf7df0288fda062e5a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/75/224575/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Few modifications to group some ovs-vsctl ops as transactions.
Some of the vsctl calls cannot be clubbed due to their
inter-dependencies for data/logic as it is structured in the
current agent code. Also there is open flow add/mod calls
to ofctl which also could be optimized if they can be clubbed.
Couldn't find a way to provide multiple commands to ofctl.

Pending...
- ofctl flow adds/mods are still not batched/bundled
- getportofport() calls are still not batched

This patch is to get some early feedback to judge if it is
headed in the right direction, and whether it will bring in
some perf improvements in 100+ (many) node environments.
Please help in testing the patch in your many node env.
If the results are positive, I'll continue working on
this to further optimize.

commit_message:
loadimpact perf improvement with batched ovs-vsctl statements

Few modifications to group some ovs-vsctl ops as transactions.
Some of the vsctl calls cannot be clubbed due to their
inter-dependencies for data/logic as it is structured in the
current agent code. Also there is open flow add/mod calls
to ofctl which also could be optimized if they can be clubbed.
Couldn't find a way to provide multiple commands to ofctl.

Pending...
- ofctl flow adds/mods are still not batched/bundled
- getportofport() calls are still not batched

This patch is to get some early feedback to judge if it is
headed in the right direction, and whether it will bring in
some perf improvements in 100+ (many) node environments.
Please help in testing the patch in your many node env.
If the results are positive, I'll continue working on
this to further optimize.

Need comments/suggestions on how to bundle ofctl
adds/mods and further improve upon the changes
submitted here.

Change-Id: Ie20f124beb6ecb92efad3622a33c008025e659ab
Partial-Bug: 1264608

commit_message:
CONF.reset does not happen for all tests

DietTestCase does not currently reset the global CONF
object. Any test that inherits from DietTestCase
directly could have potential left over configuration
values from previous tests in the same worker process.
This could lead to errors very difficult to diagnose.

(failing in the gate)

Change-Id: Ied61cd714639986add137577fffca07cd5a09c1b

commit_message:
provision_local_vlan no flooding flows with l2pop

Fixes the bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1312257

When l2-population option is activated the provision_local_vlan will not setup a flow to flood packets.

Change-Id: I0673a8c73ffb3a55d5f47112aab483fef50baaf7

The purpose of this commit is to identify what "could" be moved to a
library, and what it takes to do that (realizing the chain of depend-
encies, in some cases).

For the actual migration, we need to think about "whether" items should
be moved, and where the division should be, for modules that are not
moved en-masse. There may be cases where we need to refactor the code,
to tease apart the needed library functionality.

Some tricky areas (deciding the dividing point or separating dependencies)
may be:

- database
- migration
- plugin
- API extensions

Areas so far, that seemed easy are:

- constants
- exceptions
- callbacks
- i18n

Note: Need to tag items with debtcollector.

commit_message:
Redirecting some modules to a neutron-lib DO NOT MERGE

The purpose of this commit is to identify what "could" be moved to a
library, and what it takes to do that (realizing the chain of depend-
encies, in some cases).

For the actual migration, we need to think about "whether" items should
be moved, and where the division should be, for modules that are not
moved en-masse. There may be cases where we need to refactor the code,
to tease apart the needed library functionality.

Some tricky areas (deciding the dividing point or separating dependencies)
may be:

- database
- migration
- plugin
- API extensions
- policy
- context

Areas so far, that seemed easy are:

- constants
- exceptions
- callbacks

TODO: Check if any using i18n and put them back.

Note: Need to tag items with debtcollector.

Change-Id: I8e30117035b76b622caa74872fa1908cd2cf7c8f

" "No available network found in maximum allowed attempts.") class SubnetMismatchForPort(BadRequest): message = _("Subnet on port %(port_id)s does not match " "the requested subnet %(subnet_id)s.") class MalformedRequestBody(BadRequest): message = _("Malformed request body: %(reason)s.") class Invalid(NeutronException): def __init__(self, message=None): self.message = message super(Invalid, self).__init__() class InvalidInput(BadRequest): message = _("Invalid input for operation: %(error_message)s.") class InvalidAllocationPool(BadRequest): message = _("The allocation pool %(pool)s is not valid.") class UnsupportedPortDeviceOwner(Conflict): message = _("Operation %(op)s is not supported for device_owner " "%(device_owner)s on port %(port_id)s.") class OverlappingAllocationPools(Conflict): message = _("Found overlapping allocation pools: " "%(pool_1)s %(pool_2)s for subnet %(subnet_cidr)s.") class OutOfBoundsAllocationPool(BadRequest): message = _("The allocation pool %(pool)s spans " "beyond the subnet cidr %(subnet_cidr)s.") class MacAddressGenerationFailure(ServiceUnavailable): message = _("Unable to generate unique mac on network %(net_id)s.") class IpAddressGenerationFailure(Conflict): message = _("No more IP addresses available on network %(net_id)s.") class BridgeDoesNotExist(NeutronException): message = _("Bridge %(bridge)s does not exist.") class PreexistingDeviceFailure(NeutronException): message = _("Creation failed. %(dev_name)s already exists.") class QuotaResourceUnknown(NotFound): message = _("Unknown quota resources %(unknown)s.") class OverQuota(Conflict): message = _("Quota exceeded for resources: %(overs)s.") class QuotaMissingTenant(BadRequest): message = _("Tenant-id was missing from quota request.") class InvalidQuotaValue(Conflict): message = _("Change would make usage less than 0 for the following " "resources: %(unders)s.") class InvalidSharedSetting(Conflict): message = _("Unable to reconfigure sharing settings for network " "%(network)s. added_lines: def get_tenant_filters(context, action): if context.is_admin: return [] if action not in _ENFORCER.rules: # default to owner match to preserve previous behavior return ['tenant_id'] rules = _get_match_entries(action) import pdb; pdb.set_trace() class AndList(list): is_and = True class OrList(list): is_and = False def _get_match_entries(key): LOG.error("Attempting lookup of %s" % key) rule = _ENFORCER.rules[key] matches = AndList() import pdb; pdb.set_trace() if isinstance(rule, policy.RuleCheck): matches.append(_get_match_entries(rule.match)) elif isinstance(rule, policy.AndCheck): ands = AndList() for subrule in rule.rules: ands.append(_get_match_entries(subrule.match)) matches.append(ands) elif isinstance(rule, policy.OrCheck): ors = OrList() for subrule in rule.rules: ors.append(_get_match_entries(subrule.match)) matches.append(ors) return matches

commit_message:
Add stt type driver to ML2

This patch adds a type driver to leverage the STT protocol that was recently
added to OpenvSwitch. For more details about STT checkout:
https://tools.ietf.org/pdf/draft-davie-stt-06.pdf

DocImpact
Closes-bug: 1461068
Change-Id: Ife8fbd7933ffafb44dd930b513f36fe560d395d6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/31/180331/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: stt = neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.type_stt:SttTypeDriver

commit_message:
Mechanism driver status sync

Add mdsyncstatus DB to record the failure caused by
update_xxx_post_commit mechanism driver(s).
Add a period function to loop the record in this DB, try to re-call
the previous failed method, and update the DB based on the result.
Add a RESTful API to show the DB content.

DocImpact
APIImpact

Change-Id: I08f8f4d6bc259b39d4100b0df17a1933e6e021b9

subject: Set kernel gc_thresh values to higher config value
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-28 23:21:09.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/config.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/agent.py', 'etc/l3_agent.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5e649ee7449cba1778dc68778a171181a6b085c9', 'message': "Set kernel gc_thresh values to higher config value

The gc_thresh values that control the maximum size of the kernel's
ARP table and IPv6 neighbor table are low for a node serving hundreds
of tenants.

This patch makes the L3 agent set this to a configurable minimum at
startup with a default set to a more realistic value for an L3 node.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: #1490060
Change-Id: I6aac66fb8e96d337f34a08276cdc98885cdc56f6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Benton <blak111@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Set kernel gc_thresh values to higher config value

The gc_thresh values that control the maximum size of the kernel's
ARP table and IPv6 neighbor table are low for a node serving hundreds
of tenants.

This patch makes the L3 agent set this to a configurable minimum at
startup with a default set to a more realistic value for an L3 node.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: #1490060
Change-Id: I6aac66fb8e96d337f34a08276cdc98885cdc56f6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Benton <blak111@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/12/218512/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Base number for neighbor entries for IPv4 and IPv6. # This ensures that net.ipv6.neigh.default.gc_thresh1 # and net.ipv4.neigh.default.gc_thresh1 are at least set # to this number and gc_thresh2 and gc_thresh3 are set to # this number * 4 and 8, respectively. # gc_threshold_minimum = 1024

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-09 05:11:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient/commit/990212a8787120121fbd81032b6d53705c104029', 'message': "Fix the regression of neutronclient/shell.py

Now,in python-neutronclient,
We can't get authentication with os-token and os-url.
but on Icehouse,We can do this.
The problem is below:
in icehouse version, if os_token has been given,
auth_session is no longer need to get again.
in now version, this judge is missed, so it do again.
and the error happens, because  parameter value(auth_url)
is not provided.(Ofcourse,it should not be provided )

Change-Id: I5f1bdc605977397e80a79b04d709881c8a8a4389
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the regression of neutronclient/shell.py

Now,in python-neutronclient,
We can't get authentication with os-token and os-url.
but on Icehouse,We can do this.
The problem is below:
in icehouse version, if os_token has been given,
auth_session is no longer need to get again.
in now version, this judge is missed, so it do again.
and the error happens, because  parameter value(auth_url)
is not provided.(Ofcourse,it should not be provided )

I add this judge to fix the  regression
Closes-Bug: #1450414

Change-Id: I5f1bdc605977397e80a79b04d709881c8a8a4389
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/94/221594/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # if the self.options.os_token exists, don't get again. auth_session = None auth = None if not self.options.os_token: auth_session = self._get_keystone_session() auth = auth_session.auth
deleted_lines: auth_session = self._get_keystone_session() auth = auth_session.auth

generic.

commit_message:
Common l2_extension test code moved to the right directory

neutron/tests/common/agents belong to dummy agents used during functional
testing. This patch creates neutron/tests/common/agent to hold
common agent test code available to the different types of testing,
in this case this code is used by functional, and will be reused in
fullstack testing.
neutron/tests/common/agents is renamed to test_agents to make clear
those are small agents tuned for test.

Change-Id: I89fdfe861303fd69cd7e90af92b6a4f746716cea

commit_message:
Downgrade 'device not on plugin' to debug

These messages frequently occur when a port was updated
right before it was deleted. It's a normal condition during
a busy system so it's not worth bothering operators about
it.

Change-Id: I5d3b1123e5f3e0da369b582368b691ebf0d4eebe

commit_message:
Invalid fixed-ip value should return meaningful message

Current if the fixed-ip value is invalid, neutron client
returns ValueError exception from the dict to user.
In order to provide more meaningful error, Neutron client
should catch the ValueError and return a meaningful
error instead.

Steps to reproduce:
1. neutron port-create --fixed-ip 10.0.0.4 private

It will return dictionary update sequence element #0 has
length 1; 2 is required

Change-Id: I2aac38ab2908cdcf56a32289bd0a80e9ca25d077
Closes-bug: 1423747

commit_message:
Open vSwitch vhost-user support via fast path detection

Partial-Bug: 1512629

Change-Id: I4526cb96365827478e13dee48491f79cc495e4c9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/44/241144/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================================= Open vSwitch vhost-user support via fast path detection ======================================================= https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1512629 Fast path technology is a user-space stack for high performance packets offloading the Linux networking functions: IPv4/IPv6 routing, linux bridge, OVS, iptables, conntrack... Fast path is deployed on the compute nodes to offload the packet processing. It can be configured with standard linux commands (i.e. iproute2, ovs-vsctl, ...), which allow to support Neutron Mechanism Driver/Agents based on Linux bridge or Open vSwitch. To benefit from the offloading, a VM needs to use vhost-user instead of vhost-net backend for virtio interfaces. As a consequence, we have a forked ML2 mechanism driver called ovs-fp. [1] This mechanism driver provides vhostuser vif type in the try_to_bind_segment_for_agent method instead of ovs vif type. Problem Description =================== We need to maintain a fork version of the ML2 ovs mechanism driver and potentialy one for the ovs agent [2], it is not a proper design. From users point of view, having to install a specific mechanism driver and an agent to benefit of the fastpath offloading, it is an extra operation. We should avoid to add extra operation for easiness. Proposed Change =============== We propose to add some modifications into the OVS agent and ML2 mechanism drivers for generic vhost-user support. OVS Agent --------- The OVS agent shall detect whether a fast path offload is enabled, and it shall report it to the mechanism driver with the use of agent_state. For this capability, a new field will be added in agent_state.configuration: fp_offload. ML2 OVS ------- The mechanism driver OVS in the try_bind_segment_for_agent will: - set the vif_type to OVS if agent['configuration']['fp_support'] is False - set the vif_type to VHOSTUSER if agent['configuration']['fp_support'] is True Specific vif_details need to be added for vhost-user: - vhost_user_socket (i.e '/tmp/vhost-sock-XXXX') - vhost_user_ovs_plug should be set True - vhost_user_ovs_type should be set to 'ovs-fp'. Note: The vhost_user_ovs_type is a modification under review in Nova. [3] networking-6wind ---------------- The forked ML2 OVS (and OVS Agent) will be removed for this repository. Only the devstack plugin will be keep it. References ========== [1] https://github.com/openstack/networking-6wind/blob/master/networking_6wind/ml2_drivers/mech_ovs_fp.py [2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1511250 [3] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/libvirt-vif-vhostuser-ovs-fp

commit_message:
[WIP] Add vhost-user support for linux bridge via fp_offload detection

- add a new field in agent_state.configuration: fp_offload to report
  to the mechanism driver.

- modify LinuxBridge mech driver:
  - to set vif_type to vhost-user when fp_offload is True, else set vif_type
    to VIF_TYPE_BRIDGE like before.
  - to add new fields (vhost_user_socket, vhost_user_fp_plug) to vif_details
    when fp_offload is True.

- update the unit test for LinuxBridge to generate VIF_TYPE and VIF_DETAILS
  in function of FP_OFFLOAD. By default, FP_OFFLOAD is set to False.
  A new unit tests is added for testing when FP_OFFLOAD is True.

Closes-Bug: #1517146
Change-Id: If949471dc906838e21d308d0930485901a6cba00
Signed-off-by: Maxime Leroy <maxime.leroy@6wind.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/36/246536/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.agent.linux.fp_lib import get_vhost_user_socket_path def get_vif_type(self, agent): fp_offload = agent['configurations']['fp_offload'] if fp_offload is True: return portbindings.VIF_TYPE_VHOST_USER else: return self.vif_type def get_vif_details(self, context, agent): fp_offload = agent['configurations']['fp_offload'] if fp_offload is False: return self.vif_details vif_details = self.vif_details.copy() vif_details[portbindings.VHOST_USER_SOCKET] = ( get_vhost_user_socket_path(context.current['id'])) vif_details[portbindings.VHOST_USER_FP_PLUG] = True return vif_details

commit_message:
neutron lbaas should add timestamp field

Now the related bp(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/210955/) would
add a timestamp field to neutron core resources. And make the patch
'I24114b464403435d9c1e1e123d2bc2f37c8fc6ea' depends on this patch.

As neutron lbaas uses the modified resource file like models_v2.py,
so lbaas should add the same fields to the neutron resource which
it use. This patch will fit the requirement of bp.

Partially-Implements: blueprint add-port-timestamp
Change-Id: I2a01e57d38a69e8534d748518355e79c187a2544
Closes-Bug: #1492683

commit_message:
Add timestamp for neutron extension resources

Currently, neutron extension resources (like router, floatingip,
securitygroup and securitygrouprule) don't savexs time-stamps upon
their creation and updation. This information is critical for
debugging and perfomance purposes.

This patch base on patch: I24114b464403435d9c1e1e123d2bc2f37c8fc6ea
to add timestamp fields to neutron extension resources.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: I4789771779dcb14beb08b766c8c43019853c4015

commit_message:
Display function name exceeding scheduled interval

The following bug fix replaces the 'task' message displayed in the
FixedIntervalLoopingCall error message whenever the sublass
exceeds its scheduled interval. The 'task' message was changed from
displaying the python object to displaying the function exceeding its
schedule.

Previous message exaple:
WARNING neutron.openstack.common.loopingcall [req-4f447ecc-0ea4-4651-
883b-1f7dab14beba ] task <bound method Service.periodic_tasks of
<neutron.service.Service object at 0x3206290>> run outlasted interval
by 20.02 sec

New message example:
WARNING neutron.openstack.common.loopingcall [req-4f447ecc-0ea4-4651-
883b-1f7dab14beba ] task <'L3NATAgentWithStateReport.periodic_sync_
routers_task'> run outlasted interval by 20.02 sec

Partial-bug: #1509008

Change-Id: I3dce1c9cb945f18f268bdd2fcedd34cbfc5664d6

commit_message:
WIP Remove deprecated external_network_bridge option

L3 agent external_network_bridge option has been deprecated in Liberty.
This change removes it.

TODO:
* Handle L3 RPC old versions
* Update L3 RPC version
* Remove useless get_external_network_id functions/methods
* Update unit/functional/fullstack tests
* Document/Automate(?) migration

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact
Closes-Bug: #1508188
Related-Bug: #1491668
Change-Id: I5489401de482bd8e870f64759e2d943fbb54f9d3

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2012 OpenStack Foundation. # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import copy import mock from neutron.api.v2 import attributes as attr from neutron.extensions import classifier from neutron.plugins.common import constants from neutron.tests.unit.api.v2 import test_base as test_api_v2 from neutron.tests.unit.extensions import base as extension import oslo_db.exception as exc from oslo_utils import uuidutils DB_PLUGIN_KLASS = ('neutron.tests.unit.extensions.test_classifier.' 'ClassifierTestPlugin') _uuid = uuidutils.generate_uuid _get_path = test_api_v2._get_path _long_name = 'x' * (attr.NAME_MAX_LEN + 1) _long_description = 'y' * (attr.DESCRIPTION_MAX_LEN + 1) class ClassifiersExtensionTestCase(extension.ExtensionTestCase): fmt = 'json' def setUp(self): super(ClassifiersExtensionTestCase, self).setUp() self._setUpExtension( 'neutron.extensions.classifier.ClassifierPluginBase', constants.CLASSIFIER, classifier.RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP, classifier.classifier, 'cf', supported_extension_aliases='classifier') def _test_create_classifier(self, src_port, dst_port): cf_id = _uuid() data = {'classifier': {'description': 'descr_classifier1', 'name': 'rule1', 'protocol': 'tcp', 'source_port': src_port, 'destination_port': dst_port, 'ethertype': 'IPv4', 'source_ip_prefix': '10.0.0.0/24', 'destination_ip_prefix': '10.2.0.0/24', 'source_mac': '01:60:6e:7e:73:e7', 'destination_mac': '03:01:b2:13:fe:3c', 'vlan_priority': '1', 'inner_vlan_priority': '1', 'dscp_tag': '12', 'dscp_mask': '144', 'encapsulation_type': 'ppp', 'encapsulation_id': '1111', 'tenant_id': _uuid()}} expected_ret_val = copy.copy(data['classifier']) expected_ret_val['source_port'] = str(src_port) expected_ret_val['destination_port'] = str(dst_port) expected_call_args = copy.copy(expected_ret_val) expected_ret_val['id'] = cf_id instance = self.plugin.return_value instance.create_classifier.return_value = expected_ret_val res = self.api.post(_get_path('classifiers', fmt=self.fmt), self.serialize(data), content_type='application/%s' % self.fmt) instance.create_classifier.assert_called_with( mock.ANY, classifier={'classifier': expected_call_args}) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, exc.HTTPCreated.code) res = self.deserialize(res) self.assertIn('classifier', res) self.assertEqual(res['classifier'], expected_ret_val) def test_create_classifier_with_integer_ports(self): self._test_create_classifier(1, 10) def test_create_classifier_with_string_ports(self): self._test_create_classifier('1', '10') def test_create_classifier_with_port_range(self): self._test_create_classifier('1:20', '30:40') def test_create_classifier_invalid_long_name(self): data = {'classifier': {'description': 'descr_classifier1', 'name': _long_name, 'protocol': 'tcp', 'source_port': '1', 'destination_port': '1', 'ethertype': 'IPv4', 'source_ip_prefix': '10.0.0.0/24', 'destination_ip_prefix': '10.2.0.0/24', 'source_mac': '01:60:6e:7e:73:e7', 'destination_mac': '03:01:b2:13:fe:3c', 'vlan_priority': '1', 'inner_vlan_priority': '1', 'dscp_tag': '12', 'dscp_mask': '144', 'encapsulation_type': 'ppp', 'encapsulation_id': '1111', 'tenant_id': _uuid()}} res = self.api.post(_get_path('classifiers', fmt=self.fmt), self.serialize(data), content_type='application/%s' % self.fmt, status=exc.HTTPBadRequest.code) self.assertTrue('Invalid input for name' in res.body.decode('utf-8')) def test_create_classifier_invalid_long_description(self): data = {'classifier': {'description': _long_description, 'protocol': 'tcp', 'source_port': '1', 'destination_port': '1', 'ethertype': 'IPv4', 'source_ip_prefix': '10.0.0.0/24', 'destination_ip_prefix': '10.2.0.0/24', 'source_mac': '01:60:6e:7e:73:e7', 'destination_mac': '03:01:b2:13:fe:3c', 'vlan_priority': '1', 'inner_vlan_priority': '1', 'dscp_tag': '12', 'dscp_mask': '144', 'encapsulation_type': 'ppp', 'encapsulation_id': '1111', 'tenant_id': _uuid()}} res = self.api.post(_get_path('classifiers', fmt=self.fmt), self.serialize(data), content_type='application/%s' % self.fmt, status=exc.HTTPBadRequest.code) self.assertTrue('Invalid input ' 'for description' in res.body.decode('utf-8')) def test_classifier_list(self): cf_id = _uuid() return_value = [{'tenant_id': _uuid(), 'id': cf_id}] instance = self.plugin.return_value instance.get_classifiers.return_value = return_value res = self.api.get(_get_path('classifiers', fmt=self.fmt)) instance.get_classifiers.assert_called_with(mock.ANY, fields=mock.ANY, filters=mock.ANY) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, exc.HTTPOk.code) def test_classifier_get(self): cf_id = _uuid() return_value = {'tenant_id': _uuid(), 'id': cf_id} instance = self.plugin.return_value instance.get_classifier.return_value = return_value res = self.api.get(_get_path('cf/classifiers', id=cf_id, fmt=self.fmt)) instance.get_classifier.assert_called_with(mock.ANY, cf_id, fields=mock.ANY) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, exc.HTTPOk.code) res = self.deserialize(res) self.assertIn('classifier', res) self.assertEqual(res['classifier'], return_value) def test_classifier_update(self): cf_id = _uuid() update_data = {'classifier': {'ethertype': 'IPv4'}} return_value = {'tenant_id': _uuid(), 'id': cf_id} instance = self.plugin.return_value instance.update_classifier.return_value = return_value res = self.api.put(_get_path('cf/classifiers', id=cf_id, fmt=self.fmt), self.serialize(update_data)) instance.update_classifier.assert_called_with( mock.ANY, cf_id, classifier=update_data) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, exc.HTTPOk.code) res = self.deserialize(res) self.assertIn('classifier', res) self.assertEqual(res['classifier'], return_value) def test_classifier_delete(self): self._test_entity_delete('classifier')

commit_message:
Guarantee securitygroup enforcement in ML2 mechanism drivers

Curent neutorn could not guarantee the enforcement of extensions like SG
and QOS, that will bring some problems when port_binding, like
hierarchical port binding.
This BP will introduce a new flag in MD and parameter indicated
whether enforcement is mandatory and enforcement status used in
port_binding to fix it.

Change-Id: I63b12e627b1fcd362a3a4262b25e065c570a0f7c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/56/240356/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============== Address Scopes ============== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/add-securitygroup-support-for-ml2-mechdriver Neutron has already be able to make the agentless driver receive the BEFORE/AFTER event by neutron callback logic[1]. But callback logic has a flaw, that it has no ordering guarantee[2]. It works in most of the agentless cases, but when there is sync issue between neutron DB and the controller DB which mech driver leverages, order becomes important. Problem Description =================== Proposed Change =============== Data Model Impact ----------------- None REST API Impact --------------- None Security Impact --------------- None Notifications Impact -------------------- None Other End User Impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ little cycles will be added because involve in mech drivers IPv6 Impact ----------- None Other Deployer Impact --------------------- None Developer Impact ---------------- None Community Impact ---------------- The callback event receiver in mech drivers would like to remove the listening code, and others like service plugin who interested in security group event would reserve their current way. Alternatives ------------ Need more advices. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- yalei-wang Work Items ---------- #. Add SecuritygroupContext class in driver_context.py and driver_api.py #. Add correspond methods in Ml2Plugin, which wrap the current create/update/delete operation on Securitygroup and Securitygroup rules. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Tempest Tests ------------- None Functional Tests ---------------- None API Tests --------- None Documentation Impact ==================== User Documentation ------------------ None Developer Documentation ----------------------- None References ========== [1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1444112 [2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron/devref/callbacks.html

Clean up horizon.scss - _layout.scss

A major part of the css reorg is a better organization of the css
styles themselves. horizon.scss should be a global import level file.

Move remaining layout styles to _layout.scss.  Also, fix minor
bug with min size.

Change-Id: I6dd847e65a2cbf7f8dc9e415bed4a6958e3b787e
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V unit tests for latest os_win release

os_win release 0.1.0 causes unit tests to fail, as the wmi
module does not exist. Mocking it will fix the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1533290

subject: Using session pool for p11 opertions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-09 16:28:45.000000000', 'files': ['etc/barbican/barbican.conf', 'barbican/plugin/crypto/p11_crypto.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/crypto/test_p11_crypto.py', 'barbican/plugin/crypto/pkcs11.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/486b959ef3ba5357e3c2654f2cb541225e342118', 'message': 'Using session pool for p11 opertions

Instead of open/close a p11 session for each pkcs11 calls, we can
create a pool of shared sessions when HSM crypto plugin is
initialized, all pkcs11 API calls then can grab one existing
available seesion from pool, execute the operation and return the
seesion back to the pool when the job is done.

With this change, we can see about 40% barbican key operation
performance improvement when HSM is used.

Change-Id: I8f625430a7a6aa6ce159b800542cb77c7b392963
'}]
commit_message:
Using session pool for p11 opertions

Instead of open/close a p11 session for each pkcs11 calls, we can
create a pool of shared sessions when HSM crypto plugin is
initialized, all pkcs11 API calls then can grab one existing
available seesion from pool, execute the operation and return the
seesion back to the pool when the job is done.

With this change, we can see about 40% barbican key operation
performance improvement when HSM is used.

Change-Id: I8f625430a7a6aa6ce159b800542cb77c7b392963
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/02/243202/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add the condition for using a project term

Most projects contain both their own project name and service name,
and **project name** vs. **service type** guideline is defined for
most cases. However, on current big-tent trend, some projects don't
contain them. So this patch makes the guideline clear for most cases.

Change-Id: I75cabcf0787073d96b6536c4e70b63ed73b814e3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-sig refs/changes/64/208264/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Most OpenStack projects have both a "project name" (e.g., Nova, Keystone, etc.) and a "service type" (e.g., Compute, Identity, etc.). Some REST API features (e.g., JSON-Home, API Microversions, etc.) need to expose each project in a request/response. The project *should* be represented with its **service type** if it has both a "project name" and a "service type" because its project name is subject to change (e.g., Neutron was Quantum) and its service type is more stable. The service type should come from "type" of the corresponding OpenStack Identity service catalog entry.
deleted_lines: Each OpenStack project has both a "project name" (e.g., Nova, Keystone, etc.) and a "service type" (e.g., Compute, Identity, etc.). Some REST API features (e.g., JSON-Home, API Microversions, etc.) need to expose each project in a request/response. The project *should* be represented with its **service type** because its project name is subject to change (e.g., Neutron was Quantum) and its service type is more stable. The service type should come from "type" of the corresponding OpenStack Identity service catalog entry.

Add generic name of each project for terms

We are discussing API Microversions header names and this patch
tries to build the consensus.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066957.html

added_lines: * **project name** vs. **generic name** Each OpenStack project has both project name(Nova, Keystone, etc.) and generic name(Compute, Identity, etc.). Some REST API features(JSON-Home, API Microversions) need to expose each project in a request/response. The project should be represented with **generic name** because **project name** is possibly changed like Neutron and **generic name** is more stable.

commit_message:
Run functional gate jobs in a constrained environment

This patch modifies the gate hooks to run jobs with upper constraints.

Conflicts:
        tox.ini

(cherry picked from commit fce50f3beb19dfa747ca12d11c8a0f70f7ea16a8)

subject: Call _allocate_vr_id outside of transaction
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-12 13:11:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/99d1c0d94b82784ed29c60450fe0fb382e6ae310', 'message': "Call _allocate_vr_id outside of transaction

_allocate_vr_id is called from _set_vr_id, which was starting a
transaction before calling it. This caused an error when the retry
logic was triggered inside of _allocate_vr_id since it would
encounter a DB exception and put the transaction into a bad state
that couldn't be used on the retry.

This patch just stops _set_vr_id from starting a transaction because
it didn't serve a purpose. It also stops _allocate_vr_id from allowing
subtransactions when it starts a transaction, since it's retry logic
isn't compatible with them.

Co-Authored-By: Ann Kamyshnikova <akamyshnikova@mirantis.com>
Closes-Bug: #1528201
Change-Id: If7bcae39098f40f5ee9db78d3190bf9fdaf6438b
(cherry picked from commit 18e2117e3df3c119f843aed669d0c6bae9243053)
"}]
commit_message:
Call _allocate_vr_id outside of transaction

_allocate_vr_id is called from _set_vr_id, which was starting a
transaction before calling it. This caused an error when the retry
logic was triggered inside of _allocate_vr_id since it would
encounter a DB exception and put the transaction into a bad state
that couldn't be used on the retry.

This patch just stops _set_vr_id from starting a transaction because
it didn't serve a purpose. It also stops _allocate_vr_id from allowing
subtransactions when it starts a transaction, since it's retry logic
isn't compatible with them.

Co-Authored-By: Ann Kamyshnikova <akamyshnikova@mirantis.com>
Closes-Bug: #1528201
Change-Id: If7bcae39098f40f5ee9db78d3190bf9fdaf6438b
(cherry picked from commit 18e2117e3df3c119f843aed669d0c6bae9243053)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/57/266357/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(kevinbenton): we disallow subtransactions because the # retry logic will bust any parent transactions with context.session.begin(): router.extra_attributes.ha_vr_id = self._allocate_vr_id( context, ha_network.network_id, router.id)
deleted_lines: with context.session.begin(subtransactions=True): with context.session.begin(subtransactions=True): router.extra_attributes.ha_vr_id = self._allocate_vr_id( context, ha_network.network_id, router.id)

Use git.openstack.org everywhere

Our official git master is at git.openstack.org, update places
that use github instead.

commit_message:
Add multi-node devstack support to VPNaaS

Modify devstack plugin to support multi-node confgurations
(i.e. where the network node is split from the controller node).

DocImpact: Migrate HowTo wiki page to additional devref text

Change-Id: Iac5756ffe75b2125faace54b74b296036905a9b0
Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Fix neutron resource cleanup issue

Remove ports before router and net removal, otherwise the net-resource
destroy will fail.

Change-Id: I2f81802b4ce9e34f583e3ab60bf22c7e5d2f0629
Partial-bug: #1488757
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/55/240755/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Must clean the router before we can remove a net neutron router-gateway-clear $(resource_get network router_id) || /bin/true neutron router-interface-delete $(resource_get network router_id) $(resource_get network subnet_ id) || /bin/true neutron net-delete $(resource_get network net_id) || /bin/true
deleted_lines: # BUG: for now we'll be sloppy on shutdown, once we get everything # working we'll clean up better. neutron net-delete $(resource_get network net_id) || /bin/true

commit_message:
Remove index API

The index API is a passthrough to elasticsearch. Given the changes
we're making with aliasing, and that we perform significant transforms
on raw data from the APIs, there a few legitimate reasons to do this.

A future suggested replacement is an API to request indexing of a
specific instance of a resource type that would go through the proper
serialization functions.

Change-Id: I070909176aace9c30638de7e31cd7545c8d84918
Implements: blueprint remove-index-api
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/51/259551/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def index(self, req, actions, default_index=None, default_type=None): try: search_repo = self.gateway.get_catalog_search_repo(req.context) success, errors = search_repo.index( default_index, default_type, actions) return { 'success': success, 'failed': len(errors), 'errors': errors, } except exception.Forbidden as e: raise webob.exc.HTTPForbidden(explanation=e.msg) except exception.NotFound as e: raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound(explanation=e.msg) except exception.Duplicate as e: raise webob.exc.HTTPConflict(explanation=e.msg) except Exception as e: LOG.error(encodeutils.exception_to_unicode(e)) raise webob.exc.HTTPInternalServerError() def index(self, request): body = self._get_request_body(request) self._check_allowed(body) default_index = body.pop('default_index', None) if default_index is not None: default_index = self._validate_index(default_index) default_type = body.pop('default_type', None) if default_type is not None: default_type = self._validate_doc_type(default_type) actions = self._validate_actions(body.pop('actions', None)) if not all([default_index, default_type]): for action in actions: if not any([action['_index'], default_index]): msg = (_("Action index is missing and no default " "index has been set.")) raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg) if not any([action['_type'], default_type]): msg = (_("Action document type is missing and no default " "type has been set.")) raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg) query_params = { 'default_index': default_index, 'default_type': default_type, 'actions': actions, } return query_params def index(self, response, query_result): body = json.dumps(query_result, ensure_ascii=False) response.unicode_body = six.text_type(body) response.content_type = 'application/json'

commit_message:
Fix functional test [api] config section

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/253981/ moved the API config
options to their own section; this wasn't reflected in the functional
tests, which was only a problem because the shutdown code can't deal
with multiple worker processes.

Moved bind_host, bind_port and workers to an [api] section, and
hardcoded workers=0 (since the test runner is already spawning multiple
test processes, and multiple API processes within that seems
egregious).

Change-Id: I84aa45620f426025148365057cc9edf6bca6db6f
Closes-Bug: #1532306
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/25/265425/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [api] # Hardcoding a single worker; the cleanup code can't deal with more workers = 0 bind_host = 127.0.0.1 bind_port = %(bind_port)s
deleted_lines: self.workers = 0bind_host = 127.0.0.1 bind_port = %(bind_port)sworkers = %(workers)s

commit_message:
Add config-ref-common-options.rst

Change-Id: I00cc8c392b4df9492d4ccd90ee840eb086637695
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/docs-specs refs/changes/19/262219/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================= Config Reference: document common options ========================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+spec/config-ref-common-sections Problem description =================== In the configuration reference, configuration options such as database, AMQP, keystone middleware are poorly documented, or worse, documented differently in multiple places. This might be confusing for the reader, and adds maintenance burden. Proposed change =============== Common libraries define several configuration options, used by all the OpenStack projects Instead of documenting these options for each project, we could have a specific chapter documenting the configuration options for common libraries, and refer to this chapter in the projects chapters. At the moment these options are poorly documented, so this change would also be a chance to add missing information, or at least provide a better structure to do so in the future. This spec only impacts the configuration reference. Alternatives ------------ * Document everything in all the projects chapters, leading to a lot of duplication Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: gpocentek Work Items ---------- * Generate options tables using ``autohelp`` for the common libraries. The options would not be removed from the projects tables, to keep providing a complete set of options for each project. * Add a new ``Common configuration options`` chapter to the configuration reference, documenting configuration options available in ``oslo`` and ``keystonemiddleware`` libraries. Documented libraries include (non-exhaustive list): * ``oslo.concurrency`` * ``oslo.db`` * ``oslo.log`` * ``oslo.messaging`` * ``keystonemiddleware.auth_token`` * Remove documentation for these options in the projects chapters, if necessary (AMQP with ``oslo.messaging`` is sometimes documented). * In each component chapter, add references to the common options sections. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Validate the existence of documented options using the tables generated with ``autohelp``. References ========== None

commit_message:
Magic Search now inherits from Bootstrap Theme

The magic search css was not themeable out of the box.  Also, we were
overriding almost every style in it with our own.  This causes
unneccessary complexity in the css; we should just not include it and
provide css that uses theme variables.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg

Change-Id: I116e32b64bd6ba4c8f3e65fd1e145387f3071663

added_lines: // Replaces magic_search.scss with styles for bootstrap/Horizon. /*----------------------------------------- Magic Search bar ----------------------------------------- */ .magic-search-bar .input-group { width: 100%; } background-color: $input-bg; border-radius: 0 $input-border-radius $input-border-radius 0; border: 1px solid $input-border; padding: ceil($padding-small-vertical/2) $padding-base-vertical; display: table; width: 100%; // Layout .magic-search-clear, .search-main-area { display: table-cell; } .fi-filter { display: none; } // Input Text Box .search-input { border: none; line-height: $input-height-base; padding-left: $padding-base-vertical; } // Token .item { display: inline-block; background-color: $gray-lighter; padding: $padding-small-vertical 0 $padding-small-vertical $padding-small-horizontal; border-radius: $border-radius-base; margin: ceil($padding-small-vertical/2) ceil($padding-small-vertical/2) ceil($padding-small-vertical/2) 0; &:first-child { } &:last-child { margin-right: 0; } .remove { padding: 0 $padding-small-vertical; color: $brand-danger; } } // Pre-Token Label .search-selected { color: $gray-light; padding-left: $padding-small-vertical; } // Search Bar Clear Icon .magic-search-clear { font-size: $font-size-large; color: $gray; width: $font-size-large; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center; } }
deleted_lines: // Augments magic_search.scss with styles for bootstrap/Horizon. min-width: $magic-search-min-width; border-color: $magic-search-border-color; border-radius: $magic-search-border-radius; margin-bottom: $magic-search-margin-bottom; padding: $magic-search-margin-padding; .search-entry { .search-input { padding: 1px 0px; font: normal normal normal 12.6px/normal; outline: none; height: 24px; } height: 24px; position: relative; } .item-list { .item { background-color: $gray-light; a { color: $brand-danger; } } .server-side-item { background-color: $gray-lighter; } } .fa-filter { padding-left: 5px; font-size: larger; } .fa-times { font-size: larger; } .label { font-size: 100%; font-weight: normal; } } .search-main-area { padding-left: 10px; } .hz-magic-search-bar { .magic-search-bar { width: 100%; .fa-search { cursor: auto; } } .search-bar { border-color: #cccccc; border-bottom-right-radius: 4px; border-top-right-radius: 4px; margin-bottom: 0; i.cancel { top: 0.45em; } .search-main-area { padding-left: 0.2em; } .item-list { .item { padding-right: 0.3em; padding-top: 0.3em; .remove { padding-left: 0.3em; } } } .search-selected { padding-right: 0.3em; } .search-entry { height: inherit; li { cursor: pointer; } .search-input { min-width: 260px; @include search-placeholder { font-weight: normal; color: $placeholder-text-color; } } } } }

subject: Enhance the help info of "neutron router-gateway-set"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-18 08:43:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient/commit/6a8d2c56e5e89afa979259b5a82bd9e043b027f3', 'message': 'Enhance the help info of "neutron router-gateway-set"

The the help info of "neutron router-gateway-set" is not much
helpful.

Below is the help message of "neutron router-gateway-set":

usage: neutron router-gateway-set [-h] [--request-format {json,xml}]
       [--disable-snat] [--fixed-ip FIXED_IP]
       ROUTER EXTERNAL-NETWORK
neutron router-gateway-set: error: too few arguments

Actually, need to specify subnet_id and ip_address so the
router-gateway-set command can work. Usage should be as below,

usage: neutron router-gateway-set [-h] [--request-format {json,xml}]
       [--disable-snat] [--fixed-ip subnet_id=SUBNET,ip_address=IP_ADDR]
       ROUTER EXTERNAL-NETWORK
neutron router-gateway-set: error: too few arguments

Change-Id: I2a0bbd147803108e4001ffe86594e1201b9c388b
Closes-Bug: 1527129

commit_message:
Enhance the help info of "neutron router-gateway-set"

The help info of "neutron router-gateway-set" is not much
complete.

Below is the help message of "neutron router-gateway-set":

usage: neutron router-gateway-set [-h] [--request-format {json,xml}]
       [--disable-snat] [--fixed-ip FIXED_IP]
       ROUTER EXTERNAL-NETWORK
neutron router-gateway-set: error: too few arguments

Modified the help message and added unit test.
Usage should be as below,

usage: neutron router-gateway-set [-h] [--request-format {json,xml}]
       [--disable-snat] [--fixed-ip subnet_id=SUBNET,ip_address=IP_ADDR]
       ROUTER EXTERNAL-NETWORK
neutron router-gateway-set: error: too few arguments

Change-Id: I2a0bbd147803108e4001ffe86594e1201b9c388b
Closes-Bug: 1527129

added_lines:
Application development resources for OpenStack clouds You can use SDKs, APIs, and CLIs to interact with private and public OpenStack clouds.

SDKs

A software development kit (SDK) contains code, examples, and documentation that help you create OpenStack cloud applications in the language of your choice.

Get jclouds SDK
OpenStack: Getting Started Guide Javadoc for Apache jclouds Release Notes Archive Mailing list: Report issues: Issue tracker

Get pkgcloud SDK
Getting started with pkgcloud & Openstack Mailing list: Report issues: Issue tracker

Get libcloud SDK
Getting started OpenStack Compute Driver Documentation Welcome to Apache Libcloud’s documentation! Changelog Mailing list: Report issues: Issue tracker

Get Fog SDK
Getting Started with Fog and OpenStack Mailing list: Report issues: Issue tracker

Get .NET SDK
OpenStack.NET OpenStack.NET source code OpenStack.NET issues Mailing list: Report issues: Issue tracker

Get PHP SDK
Welcome to php-opencloud! PHP OpenStack SDK PHP OpenStack SDK issues Mailing list: Report issues: Issue tracker If one of these SDKs do not support your language or use case, you can use the APIs or another known SDK.

APIs

An application programming interface (API) gives you access to service capabilities through predefined functions. Use the APIs when an SDK is not available for the programming language that you use.

See the OpenStack API Guide and OpenStack API Complete Reference to learn how to use the APIs. Or, contribute to one of the known SDKs.

CLIs

A command-line interface (CLI) is a text-based client that helps you create scripts to interact with OpenStack clouds.

Official CLIs

Install the CLIs

OpenStack End User Guide OpenStack Command-Line Interface Reference Mailing list: Report issues: Issue tracker

Application Programming Interfaces

An Application Programming Interface (API) offers a way to use the capabilities of a service by using predefined functions. Use the API when the programming language you're using is not supported in an SDK. Please consider contributing that work to one of the Known SDKs. The OpenStack API Quick Start gives you the basics for interacting with the services.

commit_message:
Add RPCIsSynchronousFixture for synchronous RPC casts

This fixture replaces RPC casts with RPC calls for testing code paths
that communicate over RPC cast in order to verify an expected state
after the path completes.

Change-Id: I198117445eff8ba75af18f1487cdbc6a03b88687
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/45/244045/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_messaging.rpc import client as messaging_rpc_clientclass RPCIsSynchronousFixture(fixtures.Fixture): """Patch the RPC cast method to be a synchronous RPC call. This is useful for testing a code path that will communicate over RPC cast in order to verify an expected state after it completes. """ def setUp(self): super(RPCIsSynchronousFixture, self).setUp() orig_prepare = messaging_rpc_client.RPCClient.prepare def fake_prepare(self, *args, **kwargs): # Remove fanout because it is not allowed in a call kwargs.pop('fanout', None) return orig_prepare(self, *args, **kwargs) # Remove fanout keyword argument self.useFixture(fixtures.MonkeyPatch( 'oslo_messaging.rpc.client.RPCClient.prepare', fake_prepare)) # Replace cast with call self.useFixture(fixtures.MonkeyPatch( 'oslo_messaging.rpc.client._CallContext.cast', messaging_rpc_client._CallContext.call))

commit_message:
A tempest test in services API using unsafe assert

Test "test_get_service_by_invalid_params" performs
unsafe assertions where two lists are compared and it
fails when order of inner elements is different, but
this case should be considered OK.

Change-Id: I15efc590d45afb6e025c0e920177c58e57eebadb
Closes-Bug: #1531667

All pre-installed packages are opensource (logstash, nfs, xfs, mesos, marathon, docker, Elasticsearch) with the exception of three docker containers which contain mostly opensource bits (Jenkins) and some CloudBees-specific bits (less than 30%). This image is used to provision VMs that are to be part of the PSE computational infrastructure. However, the pre-installed packages also make this image useful as a stand-alone appliance service: type: glance disk_format: qcow2 container_format: bare license: Multi-licensed OpenSource attributes: url: http://pse-vm-images.s3-us-west-1.amazonaws.com/images/cloudbees-pse-ubuntu-juno-20151030011613.qcow2 hash: da21abcd47b08632ea39191bb34df3fab148f9fd -

subject: Fix update quota of subprojects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-15 18:15:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/46ddcb3d42bc389a07c28003ac0f5706d4f45a8c', 'message': "Fix update quota of subprojects

Cinder raises an exception when performing an update quota
operation in a subproject in which its parent's quotas weren't
explicitly updated.

This is because cinder will try to find the parent's quotas
in order to update the allocated value. But, since the parent's
quotas are the default quotas (i.e. there are no entries for them
in the database), the operation will raise an error.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a project A in keystone;
2. Create a project B in keystone with A as its parent;
3. Try to update the quota value of any resources of project B
   (e.g. openstack quota set <id of B> --volumes 2)

This patch fix this bug by adding entries to the database when
performing an update quota operation in a subproject and there
are still no quota associated with the parent project.

Change-Id: Ia732ca9d5a5f59d3973c2656a27b666077c3402a
Closes-bug: #1495990
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-15 18:17:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/78f21d4de1abe9a8582dde83b592cc4e002c503d', 'message': "Fix update quota of subprojects

Cinder raises an exception when performing an update quota
operation in a subproject in which its parent's quotas weren't
explicitly updated.

This is because cinder will try to find the parent's quotas
in order to update the allocated value. But, since the parent's
quotas are the default quotas (i.e. there are no entries for them
in the database), the operation will raise an error.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a project A in keystone;
2. Create a project B in keystone with A as its parent;
3. Try to update the quota value of any resources of project B
   (e.g. openstack quota set <id of B> --volumes 2)

This patch fix this bug by adding entries to the database when
performing an update quota operation in a subproject and there
are still no quota associated with the parent project.

commit_message:
Fix update quota of subprojects

Cinder raises an exception when performing an update quota
operation in a subproject in which its parent's quotas weren't
explicitly updated.

This is because cinder will try to find the parent's quotas
in order to update the allocated value. But, since the parent's
quotas are the default quotas (i.e. there are no entries for them
in the database), the operation will raise an error.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a project A in keystone;
2. Create a project B in keystone with A as its parent;
3. Try to update the quota value of any resources of project B
   (e.g. openstack quota set <id of B> --volumes 2)

This patch fix this bug by adding entries to the database when
performing an update quota operation in a subproject and there
are still no quota associated with the parent project.

Change-Id: Ia732ca9d5a5f59d3973c2656a27b666077c3402a
Closes-bug: #1495990

commit_message:
Make _discover_extensions public

Heat wants to use
`cinderclient.shell.OpenStackCinderShell._discover_extensions`
function (https://bugs.launchpad.net/heat/+bug/1527071),
which is private currently. It's better to change this method
to public for public use.
This change will do it as novaclient did.

Change-Id: Iaaa4cab530fd495877e15a372fff1354ddbeaa17
Closes-Bug: #1527169

commit_message:
Deprecated tox -downloadcache option removed

Caching is enabled by default from pip version 6.0

More info:
https://testrun.org/tox/latest/config.html#confval-downloadcache=path
https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/reference/pip_install/#caching

Change-Id: I550e5bc542d52387d3279cbcaf3dd8e55668d521

subject: Fix leak from tempest.conf in fake_config fixture
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-28 22:59:29.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/fake_config.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/0ae551fdf57ecdd95963e683c9eccbb5dfdf43c4', 'message': 'Fix leak from tempest.conf in fake_config fixture

The config fixture used in Tempest unit tests
(tests.fake_config.ConfigFixture) does not reset the
cfg.CONF/config.CONF values when the test class is initialized.
If config.CONF already exists (e.g. with values from tempest.conf file
that have been retrieved during test discovery/load), then incorrect
config settings might be used during a unit test.

There is a statement to (re)initialize cfg.CONF in the init of
tests.fake_config.FakePrivate (this is a stub for
config.TempestConfigPrivate). However if config.CONF already has
attribute _config (of type TempestConfigPrivate), then
TempestConfigPrivate is not called during the test (due to
logic in __getattr__ method in config.TempestConfigProxy class). So if
config.CONF was created before start of the unit test, stub FakePrivate
is not initialized and as a result cfg.CONF is not reset.

This patch moves the (re)initialization of cfg.CONF from FakePrivate to
ConfigFixture class to ensure that cfg.CONF/config.CONF reset is also
executed if config.CONF already exists before start of the unit test.

Partial-Bug: #1508815

Change-Id: I9525628ffd263dd2ed3ad2411f24548dfd50f747
'}]
commit_message:
Fix leak from tempest.conf in fake_config fixture

The config fixture used in Tempest unit tests
(tests.fake_config.ConfigFixture) does not reset the
cfg.CONF/config.CONF values when the test class is initialized.
If config.CONF already exists (e.g. with values from tempest.conf file
that have been retrieved during test discovery/load), then incorrect
config settings might be used during a unit test.

There is a statement to (re)initialize cfg.CONF in the init of
tests.fake_config.FakePrivate (this is a stub for
config.TempestConfigPrivate). However if config.CONF already has
attribute _config (of type TempestConfigPrivate), then
TempestConfigPrivate is not called during the test (due to
logic in __getattr__ method in config.TempestConfigProxy class). So if
config.CONF was created before start of the unit test, stub FakePrivate
is not initialized and as a result cfg.CONF is not reset.

This patch moves the (re)initialization of cfg.CONF from FakePrivate to
ConfigFixture class to ensure that cfg.CONF/config.CONF reset is also
executed if config.CONF already exists before start of the unit test.

Partial-Bug: #1508815

Change-Id: I9525628ffd263dd2ed3ad2411f24548dfd50f747

commit_message:
use keystoneclient exceptions instead of oslo-incubator code

depending on any oslo-incubator code from another project is
dangerous. keystoneclient makes its exceptions public and it's
not recommended to use any code from
keystoneclient.openstack.common.apiclient since it's maintained
by oslo-incubator.

Change-Id: Ibfd9d364d3199fb485987edef06e1de916e57ee5

commit_message:
Reimplement p11_crypto and pkcs11 modules

Rewrote the p11_crypto and pkcs11 modules to implement more efficent
session handling, and improved master key and project key caching.

There is also a clear division between p11_crypto and pkcs11.

Change-Id: Icefd9ff92482dd93c507953efd5de6b859c03ab0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/91/243291/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import mock from barbican.plugin.crypto import pkcs11 from barbican.tests import utils class WhenTestingPKCS11(utils.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(WhenTestingPKCS11, self).setUp() self.lib = mock.Mock() self.lib.C_Initialize.return_value = pkcs11.CKR_OK self.lib.C_OpenSession.side_effect = self._open_session self.lib.C_CloseSession.return_value = pkcs11.CKR_OK self.lib.C_GetSessionInfo.side_effect = self._get_session_user self.lib.C_Login.return_value = pkcs11.CKR_OK self.lib.C_FindObjectsInit.return_value = pkcs11.CKR_OK self.lib.C_FindObjects.side_effect = self._find_objects_one self.lib.C_FindObjectsFinal.return_value = pkcs11.CKR_OK self.lib.C_GenerateKey.side_effect = self._generate_key self.lib.C_GenerateRandom.side_effect = self._generate_random self.lib.C_EncryptInit.return_value = pkcs11.CKR_OK self.lib.C_Encrypt.side_effect = self._encrypt self.lib.C_DecryptInit.return_value = pkcs11.CKR_OK self.lib.C_Decrypt.side_effect = self._decrypt self.lib.C_WrapKey.side_effect = self._wrap_key self.lib.C_UnwrapKey.side_effect = self._unwrap_key self.lib.C_SignInit.return_value = pkcs11.CKR_OK self.lib.C_Sign.side_effect = self._sign self.lib.C_VerifyInit.return_value = pkcs11.CKR_OK self.lib.C_Verify.side_effect = self._verify self.lib.C_DestroyObject.return_value = pkcs11.CKR_OK self.ffi = pkcs11.build_ffi() setattr(self.ffi, 'dlopen', lambda x: self.lib) self.cfg_mock = mock.MagicMock(name='config mock') self.cfg_mock.library_path = '/dev/null' self.cfg_mock.login_passphrase = 'foobar' self.cfg_mock.rw_session = False self.cfg_mock.slot_id = 1 self.cfg_mock.algorithm = 'CKM_AES_GCM' self.pkcs11 = pkcs11.PKCS11( self.cfg_mock.library_path, self.cfg_mock.login_passphrase, self.cfg_mock.rw_session, self.cfg_mock.slot_id, ffi=self.ffi ) def _generate_random(self, session, buf, length): self.ffi.buffer(buf)[:] = b'0' * length return pkcs11.CKR_OK def _get_session_public(self, session, session_info_ptr): if self.cfg_mock.rw_session: session_info_ptr[0].state = pkcs11.CKS_RW_PUBLIC_SESSION else: session_info_ptr[0].state = pkcs11.CKS_RO_PUBLIC_SESSION return pkcs11.CKR_OK def _get_session_user(self, session, session_info_ptr): if self.cfg_mock.rw_session: session_info_ptr[0].state = pkcs11.CKS_RW_USER_FUNCTIONS else: session_info_ptr[0].state = pkcs11.CKS_RO_USER_FUNCTIONS return pkcs11.CKR_OK def _open_session(self, *args, **kwargs): args[4][0] = long(1) return pkcs11.CKR_OK def _find_objects_one(self, session, obj_handle_ptr, max_count, count): obj_handle_ptr[0] = long(2) count[0] = 1 return pkcs11.CKR_OK def _find_objects_two(self, session, obj_handle_ptr, max_count, count): obj_handle_ptr[0] = long(2) count[0] = 2 return pkcs11.CKR_OK def _find_objects_zero(self, session, obj_handle_ptr, max_count, count): count[0] = 0 return pkcs11.CKR_OK def _generate_key(self, session, mech, attributes, attributes_len, obj_handle_ptr): obj_handle_ptr[0] = long(3) return pkcs11.CKR_OK def _encrypt(self, session, pt, pt_len, ct, ct_len): self.ffi.buffer(ct)[:] = pt[::-1] + '0' * self.pkcs11.gcmtagsize return pkcs11.CKR_OK def _decrypt(self, session, ct, ct_len, pt, pt_len): self.ffi.buffer(pt)[:] = ct[:-self.pkcs11.gcmtagsize][::-1] return pkcs11.CKR_OK def _wrap_key(self, *args, **kwargs): wrapped_key = args[4] wrapped_key_len = args[5] wrapped_key_len[0] = long(16) if wrapped_key != self.ffi.NULL: self.ffi.buffer(wrapped_key)[:] = '0' * 16 return pkcs11.CKR_OK def _unwrap_key(self, *args, **kwargs): unwrapped_key = args[7] unwrapped_key[0] = long(1) return pkcs11.CKR_OK def _sign(self, *args, **kwargs): buf = args[3] buf_len = args[4] self.ffi.buffer(buf)[:] = '0' * buf_len[0] return pkcs11.CKR_OK def _verify(self, *args, **kwargs): return pkcs11.CKR_OK def test_public_get_session(self): self.lib.C_GetSessionInfo.side_effect = self._get_session_public sess = self.pkcs11.get_session() self.assertEqual(sess, 1) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_OpenSession.call_count, 2) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_GetSessionInfo.call_count, 2) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_Login.call_count, 1) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_CloseSession.call_count, 1) def test_user_get_session(self): self.pkcs11.get_session() self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_OpenSession.call_count, 2) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_GetSessionInfo.call_count, 2) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_Login.call_count, 0) def test_generate_random(self): r = self.pkcs11.generate_random(32, mock.MagicMock()) self.assertEqual(r, '0' * 32) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_GenerateRandom.call_count, 2) def test_rng_self_test_fail(self): def _bad_generate_random(session, buf, length): self.ffi.buffer(buf)[:] = b'\x00' * length return pkcs11.CKR_OK self.lib.C_GenerateRandom.side_effect = _bad_generate_random self.assertRaises(pkcs11.P11CryptoPluginException, self.pkcs11._rng_self_test, mock.MagicMock()) def test_get_key_handle_one_key(self): key = self.pkcs11.get_key_handle('foo', mock.MagicMock()) self.assertEqual(key, 2) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_FindObjectsInit.call_count, 1) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_FindObjects.call_count, 1) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_FindObjectsFinal.call_count, 1) def test_get_key_handle_no_keys(self): self.lib.C_FindObjects.side_effect = self._find_objects_zero key = self.pkcs11.get_key_handle('foo', mock.MagicMock()) self.assertIsNone(key) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_FindObjectsInit.call_count, 1) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_FindObjects.call_count, 1) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_FindObjectsFinal.call_count, 1) def test_get_key_handle_multiple_keys(self): self.lib.C_FindObjects.side_effect = self._find_objects_two self.assertRaises(pkcs11.P11CryptoPluginKeyException, self.pkcs11.get_key_handle, 'foo', mock.MagicMock()) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_FindObjectsInit.call_count, 1) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_FindObjects.call_count, 1) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_FindObjectsFinal.call_count, 1) def test_generate_session_key(self): key = self.pkcs11.generate_key(16, mock.MagicMock(), encrypt=True) self.assertEqual(key, 3) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_GenerateKey.call_count, 1) def test_generate_master_key(self): key = self.pkcs11.generate_key(16, mock.MagicMock(), key_label='key', encrypt=True, master_key=True) self.assertEqual(key, 3) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_GenerateKey.call_count, 1) def test_generate_key_no_flags(self): self.assertRaises(pkcs11.P11CryptoPluginException, self.pkcs11.generate_key, mock.MagicMock(), mock.MagicMock()) def test_generate_master_key_no_label(self): self.assertRaises(ValueError, self.pkcs11.generate_key, mock.MagicMock(), mock.MagicMock(), encrypt=True, master_key=True) def test_encrypt(self): pt = '0123456789ABCDEF' ct = self.pkcs11.encrypt(mock.MagicMock(), pt, mock.MagicMock()) self.assertEqual(ct['ct'][:len(pt)], pt[::-1]) self.assertTrue(len(ct['iv']) > 0) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_GenerateRandom.call_count, 2) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_EncryptInit.call_count, 1) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_Encrypt.call_count, 1) def test_decrypt(self): ct = 'FEDCBA9876543210' + '0' * self.pkcs11.gcmtagsize iv = '0' * self.pkcs11.noncesize pt = self.pkcs11.decrypt(mock.MagicMock(), iv, ct, mock.MagicMock()) self.assertEqual(pt, ct[:-self.pkcs11.gcmtagsize][::-1]) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_DecryptInit.call_count, 1) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_Decrypt.call_count, 1) def test_wrap_key(self): wkek = self.pkcs11.wrap_key(mock.Mock(), mock.Mock(), mock.Mock()) self.assertTrue(len(wkek['iv']) > 0) self.assertEqual(wkek['wrapped_key'], '0' * 16) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_GenerateRandom.call_count, 2) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_WrapKey.call_count, 2) def test_unwrap_key(self): kek = self.pkcs11.unwrap_key(mock.Mock(), '0' * 16, '0' * 16, mock.Mock()) self.assertEqual(kek, 1) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_UnwrapKey.call_count, 1) def test_compute_hmac(self): buf = self.pkcs11.compute_hmac(mock.MagicMock(), mock.MagicMock(), mock.MagicMock()) self.assertEqual(len(buf), 32) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_SignInit.call_count, 1) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_Sign.call_count, 1) def test_verify_hmac(self): self.pkcs11.verify_hmac(mock.MagicMock(), mock.MagicMock(), mock.MagicMock(), mock.MagicMock()) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_VerifyInit.call_count, 1) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_Verify.call_count, 1) def test_destroy_object(self): self.pkcs11.destroy_object(mock.MagicMock(), mock.MagicMock()) self.assertEqual(self.lib.C_DestroyObject.call_count, 1) def test_invalid_build_attributes(self): self.assertRaises(TypeError, self.pkcs11._build_attributes, [pkcs11.Attribute(pkcs11.CKA_CLASS, {})])

commit_message:
Fix WebSSO when Keystone server hostname contains 'auth'

When using WebSSO, if the Keystone server has "auth" in
the hostname, the existing regular expression below is
problematic which causes a failed replacement.

Change-Id: I564d9af4be837f83f5ef1f8b00b794befafeeb7b
Closes-Bug: #1532032

commit_message:
use keystoneclient exceptions instead of oslo-incubator code

depending on any oslo-incubator code from another project is
dangerous. keystoneclient makes its exceptions public and it's
not recommended to use any code from
keystoneclient.openstack.common.apiclient since it's maintained
by oslo-incubator.

Change-Id: I13e181d877e0483a7c5e347cad1108d39d56f971

commit_message:
Keep py3.X compatibility for urllib.urlencode

For py3.X, urllib has no attr urlencode while python 2 has.
Change urlencode to keep compatibility.

Change-Id: I48ce3271c2b6ae83b9fa7b5dcb0eb30b5534bc3d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/30/264030/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: import urllib url = '{0}?{1}'.format(url, urllib.urlencode(params)) url = '{0}?{1}'.format(url, urllib.urlencode(params))

commit_message:
Remove OpenSSL from cert_parser

Utilize cryptography package instead of OpenSSL in the cert_parser

Change-Id: I7e07138c265fd75efea0f20cd6b32819e7bd1baf
Close-Bug: 1532347

deleted_lines: import six epkey = cert_parser._read_privatekey( self.assertTrue(epkey.check()) for i in six.moves.xrange(0, len(imds)): self.assertEqual(EXPECTED_IMD_SUBJS[i], imds[i].get_subject().CN) cert_parser.get_cert_expiration, 'bad-cert-file')
